title: iOS/Andriod utvecklare
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* >4 years' experience working as an iOS/ Android developer
* Very good skills in Swift/ SwiftUI and UIKit
* Very good skills in Kotlin/ Jetpack Compose and XML based UI development
* Used to integrate and work with REST-APIs and JSON
* Experience working with Jira
* Deep understanding of iOS and Android design principles and Code standards
* Excellent skills in Kotlin and/or Java, including experience with RxJava.
* Good experience in working with Accessibility.
* Solid experience working in Android Studio and relevant troubleshooting tools.


**Meritorious**
* Prior experience working in the retail industry
* Prior experience working with Design System and reusable Design components
* Prior experience working in a larger organization
* Experience working with Scrum, agile ceremonies, and/or the SAFe framework


**Application deadline:** 
 09-12-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
*Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens digitala lösningar i en organisation som kombinerar innovation, hållbarhet och modern teknik?* 
*I rollen finns ett tydligt backend-fokus och möjligheter att arbeta med AI-relaterad utveckling och automatisering. Som Fullstack Developer hos SPP Tech blir du en viktig del av ett team som bidrar till att skapa värde för våra kunder genom smarta, datadrivna och skalbara digitala tjänster.*
 Du ingår i en av våra värdeströmmar där ett tvärfunktionellt team där utvecklare, business analysts, UX-designers, testare och affärsspecialister arbetar tätt tillsammans för att utveckla och förbättra våra digitala tjänster för individkunder.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I rollen som Fullstack Developer arbetar du med att utveckla, förvalta och vidareutveckla digitala tjänster med fokus på backend. Du bidrar aktivt i produktutvecklingen och är med och driver tekniken framåt. En viktig del av jobbet är att identifiera möjligheter där AI och datadrivna lösningar kan stärka kundupplevelsen, effektivisera processer eller förbättra våra system.
   

  

 Du kommer att:
   

  

* Utveckla, förbättra och förvalta digitala tjänster med fokus på backend
* Arbeta nära andra utvecklare genom parprogrammering och code reviews
* Bidra till innovativ produktutveckling och säkra hög teknisk kvalitet
* Utforska och tillämpa AI-möjligheter i våra lösningar
* Delta i vårt arbete mot mer datadrivna och intelligenta system


 Vi arbetar agilt och målstyrt, med fokus på att skapa kundnytta och långsiktigt hållbara lösningar. Du får goda möjligheter till kompetensutveckling genom interna forum, inspirationssessioner och strukturerat lärande.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Du är en utvecklare som kombinerar teknisk skärpa med en prestigelös och nyfiken inställning. Du trivs i tvärfunktionella team och deltar gärna aktivt i design, kravdialoger och lösningsdiskussioner. Du delar gärna kunskap, samarbetar nära andra och uttrycker dig obehindrat på både svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Din erfarenhet
   

  

* Ca 5–7 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling
* Stark backend-kompetens med erfarenhet av C#/.NET
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft Azure och moderna molnbaserade lösningar
* God förståelse för React/Typescript
* Erfarenhet av AI, ML-modeller eller datadrivna lösningar, exempelvis:
* att identifiera möjligheter för AI-användning
* dataflöden och datakvalitet
* hur AI kan integreras i befintliga system


**Varför SPP?**
 SPP är en del av den nordiska finanskoncernen Storebrand. Tillsammans skapar vi en framtid att glädjas åt genom att vägleda till ekonomiska beslut som gynnar individen, samhället och planeten långsiktigt. Vårt huvudkontor ligger i centrala Stockholm, i nyrenoverade lokaler med eget gym, träningssal och en Svanenmärkt personalrestaurang. Vi erbjuder en modern och flexibel arbetsmiljö och tillämpar en hybrid arbetsvardag med kontoret som primär arbetsplats.
   

  

 🧐 Vill du veta mer om vilka vi på SPP Tech är och vår teknikstack? Läs mer här!
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Varmt välkommen in med din ansökan senast den 7/1 2026. I stället för ett personligt brev besvarar du några frågor kopplade till tjänsten.
   

  

 För frågor om tjänsten ta kontakt med rekryterande chef Arina Thorén, arina.thoren@spp.se (Head of Digital Development Corporate) eller Lovisa Stehn, lovisa.stehn@spp.se (Rekryteringsansvarig).
   

  

 Kontaktuppgifter till våra lokala fackförbund:
   

  

*Mattias Thunström, Finansförbundet, tel 070-864 41 11
   

  

 Anna Peltovuori, Akademikerföreningen, tel 070-648 17 55*
*Med kandidatens samtycke görs en bakgrundskontroll under anställningsprocessens slutskede som innebär kontroll av personalia, ekonomiska förhållanden och juridiska frågor. Även CV och annan ansökningsdokumentation kan komma att verifieras.*

title: Alignment Developer – Germany
description:
**About Magma Math** 

 Magma Math is a startup that has quickly grown to become the leading platform for data-driven math education. By leveraging handwritten solutions in a digital format, Magma Math allows teachers to place emphasis on creativity in math, while gaining key insights into student progression. This creates a more engaging, inclusive and pedagogical math class for all students.
   

  

 Math remains the largest challenge for schools, where one in five students are considered low performers. Math is one of the core pillars on which careers are built, and we believe that school math represents one of the largest opportunities at improving educational outcomes and career prospects for children and young adults.
   

  

 Magma Math is now growing rapidly across the US and Europe. We are an ambitious team on a meaningful mission of improving math education for millions of children.
 



 ‍
 


**The Role** 

 You will work with the broader content team, focusing on curriculum for the German market. The primary aim is to ensure that math content is well-aligned for all German customers. This includes aligning content with all 16 Bundesländer, reviewing math problems, and collaborating with AI models to generate relevant content. Your aim will be to ensure that teachers have a fantastic experience where the content serves as a means for both teachers and students to achieve better math lessons.
 



 You will work closely with colleagues across the US and Europe, while also having the autonomy to drive your own projects. At Magma Math, we work very closely across teams, allowing you the opportunity to gain insight into how sales, product development, and customer success operate. For those who are eager to try new things, there are endless opportunities to expand responsibilities and grow within the company.‍‍
 



**Who you are and what you know** 




 We look for a team member who wants to take a large ownership of developing the math content experience in Magma Math. To succeed, you need to:
 


* Be very ambitious and like chasing challenging targets
* Be extremely output-oriented and find satisfaction in driving projects to completion
* Eager to learn new things, and either have a thorough understanding of mathematical curricula, or be open to learning rapidly
* Goal-oriented and accustomed to working towards deadlines
* Great at communicating
* Be hardworking and willing to join a fast-paced and rapidly growing startup‍



**Requirements**



* Bachelor's degree in any field
* German-speaking
* Attention to detail
* A good understanding of K-12 math
* A background in education is not a prerequisite, but a great asset when working with curriculum!


**What we offer** 
* Play a key role in an exciting journey. We are a young company with ambitious targets and meaningful goals
* Fantastic colleagues in a fun environment with great opportunities to learn
* Full-time job with salary and benefits
* An opportunity to work on a meaningful mission and have an exceptional impact on education, society, and how children learn math across the world.‍



**Start** 
 : ASAP.
 



**Location** 
 : Stockholm office
 



**Note 1:** 
 We maintain a 5-day in-office culture at Magma and are looking for someone who also enjoys working in the office. 
 



**Note 2:** 
 We will begin reviewing applicants in mid-January.

title: Java Developer
description:
Att välja Capgemini innebär att välja en arbetsplats där du ges möjlighet att forma din karriär på det sätt du själv önskar, där du ingår i en stödjande och inspirerande gemenskap med engagerade kollegor världen över, och där du får chansen att omdefiniera vad som är möjligt. Våra Cloud & Custom applications-team fokuserar på att utveckla skräddarsydda cloudapplikationer, integrera IT-system och driva affärstransformation, med leverans av affärskritiska cloudlösningar i hög kvalitet och hastighet, möjliggjort av Generative AI. Bli en del av oss och hjälp världsledande organisationer att frigöra teknikens värde och bygga en mer hållbar och inkluderande framtid!
   

  

 Om rollen
   

  

 Hos oss på Capgemini får du inte bara jobba med Java – du får forma framtiden. Vi ligger i framkant när det gäller Generative AI, Data Engineering och skalbara molnplattformar. Våra projekt ger dig möjlighet att utvecklas inom cutting-edge teknologier som Java, Spring, AWS, GCP, Azure, AliCloud, OpenShift, Kafka, GraphQL, React, Angular och Android. På vårt Stockholmskontor trivs vi i rymliga, ljusa lokaler med daglig frukost, nybryggt kaffe och en fantastisk utsikt över kanalen vid Barnhusbron.
   

  

 I denna roll kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att:
   

  

* Arbeta som Java Developer i spännande konsultuppdrag tillsammans med ett supporterande team omkring dig.
* Främja samarbete, proaktiv problemlösning och högkvalitativ leverans av Java-baserad programvara.
* Utnyttja din erfarenhet av Java, Spring och relaterade teknologier för att designa och utveckla robusta, skalbara och effektiva backend-system.
* Handleda andra utvecklare, genomföra kodgranskningar och driva bästa praxis.


 Din profil
   

  

* Minst 4 års erfarenhet av Java-utveckling
* Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar som AWS, GCP eller Azure är meriterande
* Kunskap inom Data Pipeline, Data Visualization eller Generative AI är ett stort plus


 Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas:
   

  

* Konkurrenskraftig lön, förmånliga tjänstepensioner och kollektivavtal som ger trygghet, samt fokus på din hälsa och ditt välmående, med initiativ för att skapa balans mellan jobb och fritid.
* En arbetsmiljö med kollegor som stöttar och inspirerar varandra, och chefer som har ditt bästa i fokus, samt ett brett utbud av karriärmöjligheter och tillgång till Capgeminis stora utbildningskatalog, särskilt inom den senaste teknologin för generativ AI och data engineering.
* En företagskultur där mångfald och inkludering värdesätts högt, samt möjligheter till internationella karriärer och ett fantastiskt nätverk av 340,000 kollegor globalt


 Ansökan
   

  

 Redo att starta ett nytt kapitel i karriären? Vi kan knappt vänta på att få höra från dig! Ansök redan idag – vi hanterar ansökningarna löpande. Under processen får du chansen att kika in på vårt kontor, prata med vår rekryterande chef och självklart ställa alla dina nyfikna frågor till vår rekryterare. Vi lovar att göra din resa mot jobbet så smidig och givande som möjligt. Är det dig vi letar efter? Vi ser fram emot att ses!
   

  

 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess kommer identitetskontroll att genomföras genom granskning av ditt ID-kort, och bakgrundskontroller kan utföras vid behov.
   

  

**Om Capgemini**
 Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda övergången till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, generativ AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2024 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Power BI-utvecklare
description:
**Bakgrund och Uppdragsbeskrivning**
 Svenska kraftnät har sedan några år en dataplattform till stöd för dataanalys och datadrivet beslutsfattande. Plattformen förvaltas och vidareutvecklas kontinuerligt. Detta arbete hanteras av en agil arbetsgrupp som består av ett team med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter. Vi behöver nu förstärka denna gruppering med en konsult som kan stötta gruppen som Poert BI-utvecklare.
   

  

 Som Power BI-utvecklare på Svenska kraftnät blir du en del av ett nyckelteam som driver organisationens datadrivna utveckling framåt.
   

  

 I denna roll arbetar du både självständigt och i nära samarbete med ditt team för att utveckla kodbaserade lösningar för att hämta, flytta, strukturera och bearbeta data. Genom effektiv datahantering tillgängliggör ni data för analys och optimering, vilket skapar insiktsdrivna beslut som stärker verksamheten både internt och externt. Vår data lake, baserad på Clouderas plattform, hanterar dataflöden från källsystem till konsumenter. Din huvudsakliga uppgift är att utveckla rapporter i Power BI baserat på behov från verksamheten men även vidareutveckla data marts i vårt datalager.
   

  

 Uppdraget avser att utföras av en resurskonsult (en tjänst som utförs av en Konsult i syfte att ge förstärkning till Svenska kraftnät i det löpande arbete som utförs av Svenska kraftnät. Utförandet av dessa tjänster leds och styrs av Svenska kraftnät).
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Du kommer att arbeta med både förvaltning och vidareutveckling av befintliga rapportlösningar, där du säkerställer att de fungerar optimalt och att incidenter hanteras snabbt och smidigt. Uppdragen varierar, från stora projektbeställningar till mindre justeringar av befintliga rapporter.
   

  

 I uppdraget ingår följande arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Utveckla, underhålla och vidareutveckla Power BI-rapporter
* Tillgängliggöra data för analys och affärsinsikter
* Utveckla och vidareutveckla ”data marts” i vårt datalager som grund för rapporter och analys

title: Application Security Engineer
description:
**🔐 Utveckla framtiden med oss!** 




 Omegapoint är ett ledande cybersäkerhetsföretag som arbetar med säker digitalisering. Här får du möjligheten att arbeta med branchens mest erfarna experter och utveckla samhällskritiska lösningar. Vi utvecklar och skyddar säkra system tillsammans med våra kunder och nu söker vi fler vassa utvecklare till vårt område Applied Security i Stockholm.
 



  





**Att jobba som Software Security Developer på Omegapoint kan exempelvis innebära att du:** 



* Stöttar utvecklingsteam i allt som rör applikationssäkerhet, från planering till implementation.
* Sätter upp användning av säkerhetsverktyg i pipelines.
* Analyserar och förklarar säkerhetsfynd, till exempel relaterade till vanliga sårbarheter som beskrivs i OWASP top 10.
* Är involverad i genomförande av hotmodelleringar.
* Granskar säkerheten i applikationer eller molnmiljöer.
* Hjälper till att utveckla eller skripta mindre komponenter.



  





 För att trivas tror vi att du är utåtriktad, driven och kvalitetsmedveten. Vi ser gärna att du har en stark vilja att utvecklas och håller dig uppdaterad om de senaste teknikerna och idéerna inom domänen.
 



  





 Vi ser även att du är en stolt utvecklare som alltid strävar efter att skapa värde. Vidare är du prestigelös och delar gärna med dig av din erfarenhet och kompetens både internt och externt.
 



  





**För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du:** 



* Har minst tre års erfarenhet och en utbildning inom systemutveckling, datavetenskap eller cybersäkerhet.
* Har förståelse för kombinationen av utveckling och säkerhet.
* Har erfarenhet av att utveckla i exempelvis Java, C# eller Python.
* Talar och skriver flytande svenska och engelska.



  





**Om Omegapoint** 




 Omegapoint grundades 2001 och är Norra Europas ledande konsultbolag inom cybersäker digitalisering. Med en vision om en framtid där vi fullt ut kan lita på teknik använder vi vår expertis för att säkra våra kunders och medarbetares utveckling. Vi är vassa och snälla, något som karaktäriseras av vår kompetensutvecklingskultur och viljan att dela vår kunskap med varandra. För närvarande är vi över 900 anställda konsulter i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Örebro, Västerås, Enköping, Uppsala, Umeå och Montreal.
 



  





**🌱 Vi satsar på dig** 




 På Omegapoint sätter vi din kompetens i centrum och ger dig alla förutsättningar för ett utvecklande och varierat jobb:
 


* **Utveckling och aktiviteter** 
 : vi ordnar regelbundet aktiviteter på vårt kontor på Vasagatan i Stockholm för att vi ska utvecklas och ha roligt tillsammans. Vi har bland annat en egen idrottsförening och festkommitté.
* **Kompetenskultur** 
 : vi samarbetar, delar kunskap och stärker varandra. Årliga kompetenskonferenser är ett självklart inslag. En gång i månaden har vi även Kompetensdag på kontoret.
* **Spännande uppdrag** 
 : vår kundbas sträcker sig från små specialistföretag till stora välkända företag och myndigheter, vilket ger både utmanande och roliga projekt.
* **Förmåner och trygghet** 
 : vi erbjuder marknadsmässiga löner, förstärkt föräldralön, anpassade förmånspaket, friskvårdsbidrag, sjukvårdsförsäkring och möjlighet till delägarskap.



  





 Men viktigast av allt – vi har en kultur där vi utvecklas tillsammans, delar kunskap och har riktigt roligt längs vägen.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Uppdragsbeskrivning
   

  

 Du blir en nyckelperson i vårt plattformsteam som ansvarar för vår centrala utvecklingsplattform – en standardiserad CI/CD-lösning baserad på GitHub och Nexus Repository. Din uppgift är att driva utvecklingen av en stabil, skalbar och modern plattform som frigör tid för våra utvecklare att skapa kundvärde.
   

  

 Vi arbetar i en hybridmiljö med Azure, on-prem och GCP, och har under 2025 påbörjat en modernisering där vi avvecklar äldre lösningar (bl.a. Jenkins) och etablerar GitHub/Nexus som framtida standard. Delar av teamet ansvarar även för Monitoring med Splunk och Grafana.
   

  

 Vi tror på samarbete och kunskapsdelning – tillsammans skapar vi bättre lösningar. Vi ansvarar för att plattformen är stabil, tillgänglig och möter verksamhetens behov, samtidigt som vi coachar utvecklare i hur de bäst använder våra verktyg.
   

  

**Krav**
* Erfarenhet av GitHub (Enterprise platform och Copilot), Nexus Repository och Azure
* Goda kunskaper inom infrastruktur och systemförvaltning, särskilt RedHat Linux i virtualiserad miljö, samt vana att arbeta i hybridmiljöer
* Erfarenhet av AKS, Terraform, ArgoCD och Ansible, samt automatisering med t.ex. PowerShell, Bash eller Python
* Förståelse för CI/CD-principer och DevOps-metodik
* Flytande i svenska och engelska
* Kompetens kring drift av Grafana (InfluxDb och Telegraf)


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av DevSecOps-arbete
* Kunskap om Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
* Erfarenhet av Splunk (Enterprise & Observability Cloud)
* Förståelse för ITIL och förändringsarbete
* Erfarenhet av Jenkins och Groovy


**Personliga egenskaper**
* Ansvarstagande och självgående
* Kommunikativ och coachande
* Lagspelare som delar kunskap och bygger samarbete
* Strategisk och analytisk med förmåga att se helheten

title: DevOps Specialist
description:
Är du en erfaren DevOps Engineer med fokus på automation, stabil drift och moderna infrastrukturlösningar? Vi söker nu en senior DevOps-specialist till en tekniktung och utvecklingsorienterad miljö där du får arbeta med plattformar som används av hela organisationen.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som DevOps Engineer jobbar du nära både utveckling och drift. Du är med och bygger, förbättrar och underhåller plattformar och leveransflöden. Målet är att skapa en stabil, säker och effektiv IT-miljö – både i molnet och on-prem.
   

  

 Du trivs i en roll där du kan påverka, förbättra och automatisera vardagen tillsammans med andra tekniska kollegor.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter:**
* Designa, drifta och vidareutveckla plattformar i hybrid- och molnmiljöer (t.ex. Azure, Kubernetes/OKD, VMware)
* Automatisera och standardisera infrastruktur med Terraform, Ansible och/eller Bicep
* Utveckla och underhålla CI/CD-pipelines (GitLab, GitHub, Git)
* Skripta för att effektivisera processer (Python, Bash eller PowerShell)
* Övervaka, felsöka och förbättra stabilitet och prestanda (Prometheus, ELK, Azure Monitor)
* Delta i change-, release- och incidenthantering enligt etablerade rutiner
* Arbeta tillsammans med utvecklare, arkitekter, driftteam och leverantörer


**Teknisk miljö:**
**Operativsystem & nätverk:** 
 Linux, Windows Server, TCP/IP, DNS
   

  

**Moln & plattformar:** 
 Azure, Kubernetes, OKD, Docker, VMware
   

  

**Automation & CI/CD:** 
 Terraform, Ansible, Bicep, GitLab CI/CD, GitHub Actions
   

  

**Skript:** 
 Python, Bash, PowerShell, Go
   

  

**Övervakning & loggning:** 
 Prometheus, ELK-stack, Azure Monitor
   

  

**Säkerhet:** 
 SSO/SCIM, systemhärdning, Zero Trust-tänk
   

  

**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet inom DevOps eller IT-infrastruktur
* Har arbetat med IaC och CI/CD som en naturlig del av ditt arbete
* Har god förståelse för containerplattformar och molnmiljöer
* Är nyfiken, självgående och gillar att samarbeta med andra
* Talar och skriver svenska och engelska obehindrat


**Meriterande:**
 Certifieringar inom Azure/DevOps, erfarenhet av GCP/AWS eller fördjupning inom IT-säkerhet.
   

  

**Om CONSULTING it:**
 När du börjar hos oss som konsult på CONSULTING it blir du en del av vår gemenskap. Du får dessutom kollegor runt om i Sverige! Du har en dedikerad konsultchef som stöttar dig och din utveckling. Vi hjälper dig hitta nya vägar genom att prova på nya roller och nya branscher, för oss är det viktigt att du trivs på din arbetsplats. Vi ser till att du hamnar på ett bra bolag under ditt uppdrag och att uppdragen ligger i linje med hur du vill utvecklas framöver. Oavsett vad det blir, står vi bakom dig hela vägen – i ditt nästa, nästa och nästa steg. Gå med i vårt team och ta del av en spännande och utvecklande arbetsmiljö!

title: Engine Systems & Tools Designer
description:
Are you passionate about designing the systems and tools that power game creation?  

  

Do you enjoy shaping workflows that make development smoother and more intuitive for artists, programmers, and designers?


Join our Engine & Tools team as an **Engine Systems & Tools Designer**, and help us bridge the gap between the engine development team and our users.


At Paradox, we are a vibrant mix of game developers and publishers, known worldwide for our strategy games. We're passionate about our gamers, with an active player base of over five million each month across the globe. We bring our games to life, creating immersive experiences for our ever-growing community.

### **What You’ll Do..**


As an **Engine Systems & Tools Designer**, you’ll design and improve systems, tools, and workflows that support developers across multiple projects. You’ll work closely with programmers, technical leads, and other disciplines to ensure that our internal tools are intuitive, scalable, and tailored for building our Grand Strategy Games. Your work will directly impact how efficiently our teams create content and build our games.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Design workflows, tools, and systems for content creation within the Engine & Tools team.
  
* Act as a central contact for understanding and shaping tools and requirements within the engine development team.
  
* Collaborate with programmers and stakeholders to ensure that tools align with both technical feasibility and creative needs.
  
* Influence tool development based on current usage, priorities, and long-term goals.
  
* Identify opportunities for shared technology and cross-project workflows.

### **What We’re Looking For**

* 3+ Years experience in UX or workflow design—preferably within game development tools and workflows.
  
* Strong understanding of the needs of technical and creative users (artists, designers, programmers).
  
* Proficiency in design and prototyping tools such as Figma, Adobe XD, or other flowcharting software.
  
* Familiarity with game development engines and tools (Unreal, Unity, or proprietary equivalents).
  
* Good interpersonal skills for working closely with programmers and other disciplines.
  
* Comfortable communicating in English, both written and spoken.

### **Good to have skills**

* Experience in C++ and Python to easier communicate with our programmers.

Working at Paradox means being part of a team that values creativity and quality, where you can make a difference and shape the world of strategy gaming. We embrace our nerdy culture, regularly interact with our fans through forums and events, and end each Friday with a social hour to unwind and connect.


If you're ready to take ownership of your work and grow as a game developer, we'd love to hear from you. Apply now and embark on an exciting journey with Paradox and the Engine & Tools team!

  


Department
Central Tech & IT
Role
Engine & Tools
Locations
Stockholm, Sweden

title: Gameplay Programmer - Unannounced Grand Strategy
description:
Join us in pioneering the next evolution of Paradox Grand Strategy, where your creativity and passion for games drive exceptional player experiences! We are in development of a brand new non-historical game led by veterans from several of our previous titles such as Hearts of Iron 4 and Crusader Kings 3, going all the way back to Europa Universalis 3.

**Your mission**
----------------


We're looking for a C++ Game Programmer who thrives in collaborative environments and is eager to take on challenges. The perfect candidate is someone who understands strategy games and wants to create the best experience for the player. We value prior experience from playing or modding our games, but a general interest in game design and UX is also beneficial.


For this role, we will prioritize candidates who are already located in Sweden.


We are in the production phase of development on a new Grand Strategy game with a highly experienced programming team. Our team nurtures an open culture where you’re encouraged to contribute in all aspects of the game and we regularly discuss technical design, art direction and game design. We encourage every team member to play an important role in our game’s success. You will be supported in your work by your tech lead, tech director and more senior programmers.


If you’re passionate about making strategy games, want to take ownership of the features you develop, and grow alongside a team of experts, then make sure to contact us!

**Key Responsibilities**
------------------------

* Build and maintain well-engineered C++ code with high levels of stability and performance.
* Design and implement features in multiple areas such as gameplay systems, user interface, graphics, and our scripting language.
* Collaborate daily with other programmers, designers and artists.
* Continue to level-up as a programmer through feature work, code reviews, guidance, and feedback.

**Requirements**
----------------

* Solid C++ knowledge.
* An interest in strategy games in general and Paradox grand strategy games in particular
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken, to effectively collaborate in our international team.
* A drive to learn and grow, taking on more responsibility and ownership over time.


Department
Games Programming
Role
Game Programmer
Locations
Stockholm - Studio Purple

title: Business Arena CX Lead to CIB CIO \u007C SEB, Stockholm
description:
Do you want to be part of shapinghow some of the Nordics’ largestcompanies andcorporates interact with their bank? SEB is looking for a CX Lead to drive the customer experience in our proprietary bank portal, Business Arena.  

 SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fuelled by collaboration. At the same time,we’rea leading financial services group in northern Europe, serving a wide spectrum of clients from small companies to large corporates and financial institutions. Business and tech are together innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, and the best digital solutions for our customers. If you are ready to make your mark on our industry and positively shape the world, you will thrive at SEB.  

About the role
As CX Lead for Business Arena, you will shape how thousands of corporate users interact with SEB daily. Business Arena is SEB’s web banking portal for corporate and institutional clients, combining services such as payments, liquidity management, FX trading, and market insights in one platform. It supports companies from SMEs to multinationals and financial institutions in their daily operations and is central to SEB’s transformation, replacing legacy channels with modern functionality.
This role is both strategic and hands-on. You’ll join our Corporate and Institutional Banking division, working closely with business stakeholders across divisions and teams in product, UX, and technology. **Your responsibilities will include to:*** Leading end-to-end CX for Business Arena – from insights and strategy to UX flows, prototypes, and design consistency.
* Developing and maintaining design principles and guidelines with product and enabler teams.
* Turning complex corporate banking needs into intuitive digital experiences through close collaboration with product, tech, and business teams.
* Representing the customer voice by running design reviews and coaching colleagues on CX quality.
* Contributing to initiatives such as personalisation, segmentation, and integrating legacy systems into a unified experience.
* Using qualitative and quantitative insights to guide design decisions.

  

To thrive in this role, we believe you have* A vast experience in UX or CX design, with a portfolio showcasing both strategic thinking and hands-on execution.
* Proven ability to independently and with a structured approach break down complex problems into addressable pieces.
* Proven ability to go from insights into actionable prototypes and design.
* Proven ability to go from insights into actionable prototypes and design.
* Experience from working with business and tech in an agile context.
* Skills in engaging both technical and non-technical stakeholders, aligning diverse perspectives around a shared vision.
* Proficiency in CX/UX tools (e.g. Figma) and an interest in leveraging AI for CX/UXdesign.
* Understanding ofcorporate customer segments and knowledge of related financial products and services(e.g. cash management, FX, authorisations) is meriting
* Excellent communication in English; Swedish is a plus.

  

We are looking for a person with a “can do” attitude. In this role you need to have the ability to focus on several things at the same time and excel in an environment of ambiguity - where energy, drive and structured thinking are essential.We believe in T-shaped profiles, where you’llcombine deep CX expertise with the curiosity and skill to dive into requirements, CX design, copy and user acceptance together with developers and product owners.  

What we offer* Agile and modern ways of working

• A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views • Strong opportunities for professional growth.* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Being part of a cross-functional team with an entrepreneurial mindset and drive to create the best solutions for our clients
* A diverse, inclusive and equal environment
* For you to play a key role in our transformation, driving the shift from legacy systems to a modern, user-friendly platform: Business Arena.
* Hybrid work model, meaning remote work is possible up to 2 days/week

  



Ready to take the next step on your career journey?
It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial to our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from. We select candidates continuously, why this position might be filled before the last date of application. Therefore, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 2026-01-19. If you have questions about the position, please contact Stella Beis Mitchell (Team manager, 070-763 50 83) or Anna Runnquist (Product manager 070-663 67 53), but we will not process applications via email.

Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.  

SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
company_description: More than 15.000 people work at SEB. Working in SEB means being part of an exciting journey, driven by digital transformation

title: Product Designer
description:
#### **About Gordon**


Gordon is a leading smart home delivery enabler for online grocery-, pharmacy- and Meal kit providers, leveraging its expertise and circular innovations to help grocery e-commerce businesses identify and capitalize on new opportunities to grow their businesses. Offering a digital platform tailor-made for temperature-controlled deliveries and end customer satisfaction in combination with a delivery infrastructure that lowers cost, we have since 2015 won the highest ranking on Trustpilot within our field in the Nordics, and the trust of leading pharmacies- and food service companies.


To take our journey to the next level, we are now looking for a **Product Designer** to join us in Stockholm.


The right candidate will not only be part of this transformative journey but will also be given great opportunities to shape the future of e-commerce logistics.

#### **About the team**


You will be joining a collaborative and dynamic team dedicated to push the boundaries of our product's capabilities. Our team is made up of frontend- and backend developers, a product owner, and a Product Designer. Together, we strive to create seamless, user-friendly experiences that meet the needs of our diverse customer base.


As our new Product Designer, you will work closely with our current product designer, forming a creative duo that drives the aesthetic and functional design of our product. Collaboration is at the heart of our process; you will find a partner in ideation, critiquing, and evolving product design. Your role will not only be about making things look great but also ensuring they meet the high standards of usability and efficiency set by the team.

#### **Our products**


Our platform revolutionizes the last mile delivery process, designed to streamline operations and enhance the delivery experience for all parties involved.


The end customer experience is facilitated through both web-based platforms and mobile applications, offering real-time tracking of deliveries and ensuring transparency and trust between the customers and drivers. This dual-interface approach caters to diverse user preferences and enhances the overall delivery experience.


Furthermore, our dedicated driver app is tailored to meet the needs of our on-ground workforce, providing them with intuitive navigation, delivery details and communication tools, all designed to make their daily operations smoother and more efficient.

#### **What You'll Do**


As a Product Designer, you will be responsible for creating seamless and intuitive experiences for our customers and drivers, focusing on end-customer interfaces. You will work on all aspects of UX, from conducting user research and designing detailed workflows and interfaces to handover to our development team, and ensure a strong visual brand in close cooperation with the Marketing team. Your work will contribute directly to making Gordon's services more accessible, enjoyable and efficient.

#### **Responsibilities**

* Design intuitive, user-friendly product interfaces for both mobile and web platforms.
* Work closely with Marketing team and relevant stakeholders to bring your designs to life, ensuring a seamless transition from design to development.
* Utilize a variety of design tools to create wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity designs.
* Analyze user feedback and activity, and iterate on designs to continuously improve the user experience.
* Stay abreast of UI & UX trends and best practices to keep our designs cutting-edge and user-centric.
* Conduct user research to gather insights into user needs and behaviors.
* Develop and maintain design systems according to Gordon Brand guidelines that ensure consistency and high-quality user experiences across all digital platforms.

#### **We are looking for someone who has**

* At least 3 years of experience in Product Design, with a proven track record of successful projects and Art Direction.
* Portfolio showcasing expertise across the entire UX spectrum of relevant past projects.
* Extensive experience working with design systems, design tokens, Figma and prototyping tools
* Exceptional skills in problem-solving, creative design thinking, and user-centered design principles.
* Worked with, or, interest in leveraging AI to elevate the design process and design system tasks.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, evolving environment.
* Excellent English communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate design decisions clearly to various stakeholders from teams such as product, operations, and engineering.
* Bachelor’s degree in Product Design, Fine Arts in Design, or equivalent.

#### **Why join Gordon?**

* Be part of a company that's transforming the last mile delivery industry.
* Work in an environment that values creativity, innovation, and employee growth.
* Join a collaborative team that’s passionate about creating exceptional user experiences.
* 

If this sounds like the perfect fit for you, **apply now.**


Since we will be evaluating candidates continuously, we encourage you to submit your application at your earliest convenience.

title: Freelance UI/UX Designer / Visual & Interaction Specialist (Immediate Need)
description:
Are you a passionate visual thinker with a deep love for creating beautiful, intuitive digital experiences?
 



  





 At Traces&Dreams, we are a community of thinkers, creators, and collaborators dedicated to building a wiser tomorrow. We are knowledge brokers who create spaces for diverse voices to explore the big questions of our time. Our work connects the traces of where we've been with the dreams of what we can become.
 



**We are urgently seeking a talented Freelance UI/UX Designer** 
 to join our fully remote team immediately. In this role, you will be a key part of our mission, responsible for the visual quality and user experience of our digital presence, ensuring our complex ideas are presented clearly and compellingly.
 **We need someone available to start on short notice.** 




  




**What you'll do:** 
* **Design and iterate on website layouts and interfaces** 
 to improve visual appeal, clarity, and overall user experience (UX).
* Create design mockups, wireframes, and prototypes for new features and visual updates, focusing on user flow and interaction.
* Translate our brand's mission and complex content into elegant, engaging, and accessible visual designs (UI - User Interface).
* Collaborate with our team to ensure the visual design supports the narrative and enhances user engagement.


- 

**Who you are:** 
* An experienced visual/interaction designer with a proven portfolio of exceptional website and digital product design (UI/UX).
* A compelling visual storyteller with a deep understanding of user-centered design principles.
* Proficient in design tools (e.g., Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD) and experienced in delivering production-ready design assets.
* Someone who thrives working independently, is highly reliable, and is able to deliver high-quality work on a consistent schedule.
* **Available immediately** 
 and ready to integrate quickly into our team.


- 


 At Traces&Dreams, how we work is just as important as what we do. Our culture is built on trust, openness, and care. We believe that true change begins with listening and understanding. If you are drawn to a place where your design expertise can directly impact the accessibility of important knowledge, we'd love to hear from you.
 



**Apply now** 
 and help us cultivate a visually stunning and accessible space where knowledge becomes action and action becomes hope.

title: Digital Designer
description:
**Digital designer (UI/visual)**
 At Above, you’ll bring bold ideas to life for some of the world’s most exciting brands, diving into a mix of daring projects alongside creative minds from every corner of the industry. We are a warm, multidisciplinary team that thrives on pushing the boundaries of digital design — supported by expert coaches, caring leaders, and a feedback-driven culture where everyone grows together.
   

  

 Once here, you will be an integral part of our design team, and have the opportunity to proactively contribute to all stages of the design process, from research to visual concepts, from design explorations to crafting compelling experiences.
   

  

**About Us**
 We believe in changing behaviors for the better, make businesses flourish, and help people in their everyday lives. And most importantly, having fun doing so. We believe in work-life balance and flexibility. We know that creativity needs to be free to flourish.
   

  

 We share a fundamental passion for innovation and design. Through our curiosity we build deeper relationships with people, industries and problems around us. Our designs are never better than our understanding of the problem we’re trying to solve.
   

  

 We are collaborators and believe that effective teams achieve world class results. Prestige is left at the doorstep.
   

  

**About You**
 We are looking for a self-starter who loves teaming up with creative minds from all disciplines, turning big ideas into even bigger results. You see challenges as opportunities, always focused on finding smart solutions that make a real impact for clients and colleagues alike. Your commitment shines through in everything you do  . You bring positive energy, spreading good vibes and a service-minded spirit wherever you go. As a true ambassador for Above, you represent us with professionalism and pride—inside and outside the studio.
   

  

**Bullet lists are hard to love, we know. You don’t have to check all of them, but it’s great if you recognize yourself in the general theme below**
* You’ve got a bachelor’s degree in visual design (or something equally awesome).
* You bring 3–5 years of visual/UI design experience, with a passion for both classic and quirky digital touchpoints — think websites and apps but also business dashboards or even EV charger screens.
* You have an eye for detail and you’re passionate about making visual design that stands out, moves the user and pushes the limits.
* You have an ability to turn business requirements, goals, and user needs into design solutions.
* You can explain and document your process, present your work and communicate your decisions.
* You have proficiency in relevant tools such as Figma.
* You’re used to the high paced agency life and love working closely with all kinds of clients.
* Bonus points if you’re skilled in design systems or motion design.
* You’re fluent in English (and if you speak Swedish, that’s a cherry on top—but not a dealbreaker!).


**A few things to keep in mind**
* Be sure to include both your CV and a portfolio that shows off your design skills.
* This role is based in Stockholm, and we love seeing each other in person — either at our inspiring office or with clients. If you’re not in Stockholm yet but ready to make the move, let us know!
* Sorry, freelancers—this one’s for future full-time Above crew only.


 We’re on the hunt for several talented designers and will keep applications open until we’ve found our dream team. If you haven’t heard from us yet, don’t worry—you’re still in the running!

title: Industrial Design Internship
description:
Above is now looking for talented Industrial Design Interns to join the creative team in both our Malmö & Stockholm studios throughout 2026. The next intake will be around February/March, as well as in August/September post-summer - but we are open to discussing individual setups outside the usual cycle. Our internships are always on-site for best exposure and collaboration, and we require a duration of 5-6 months to really get to know each other.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As an Industrial Design Intern at Above, you will get the opportunity to work with multi-disciplinary project teams on a wide variety of cutting-edge design & innovation projects for some of the world's most exciting brands.
   

  

 Once here, you will be an integral part of our design team, and have the opportunity to proactively contribute to all stages of the design process, from research to concept definition, from hands-on prototyping to crafting compelling visions. With strong conceptual thinking and a fluid software toolbox, you will have the opportunity to shape excellent project deliveries through craft and creativity. You will get the chance to work on focused industrial design engagements, and equally integrate into larger, cross-functional project constellations as part of diverse, mixed-competency teams - acting as an ambassador of the industrial design discipline while collaborating with senior colleagues.
   

  

 Our work is exciting and diverse in nature, spanning high-volume consumer products, smart home devices, furniture, robotics, future mobility experiences, progressive healthcare solutions, packaging and many more. We create impact across all levels and horizons - from category-defining hero products to multi-dimensional portfolio strategies and shaping compelling future visions alike.
   

  

**What We Are Looking For**
* An inspiring design portfolio; strong conceptual thinking and creativity
* Aesthetic sensibility balanced with a thoughtful, user-centered design approach
* Ability to adapt methods, thought-process and approach to project needs
* Fluency in CAD (Solidworks, Rhino or similar), including surfacing skills
* High-quality visualisation & animation output to express ideas and tell stories
* Hands-on mentality and familiarity with physical front-end prototyping
* Curiosity for sustainability, material innovation & manufacturing processes
* A humble, self-driven and optimistic attitude; willingness and desire to learn
* Team player, with good verbal & visual communication skills


 We are also very much interested in receiving applications from individuals that bridge disciplines or have unique profiles in-between the traditional molds - let’s talk!
   

  

**Join our team**
 Please submit your portfolio and short motivation statement. Interviews are happening on a rolling basis. Applications without a portfolio will not be considered. Our internships are always paid, and we are able to offer support with visa & work permit processes for successful international candidates.
   

  

 We’re looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Management Consultant – Service/UX/UI Designer (Stockholm)
description:
**ABOUT CAPGEMINI INVENT** 




 At frog, a part of Capgemini Invent, we believe difference drives change. As inventive transformation consultants, we blend our strategic, creative and scientific capabilities, collaborating closely with clients to deliver cutting-edge solutions. Join us to drive transformation tailored to our client's challenges of today and tomorrow. Informed and validated by science and data. Superpowered by creativity and design. All underpinned by technology created with purpose.
 



  





**YOUR ROLE** 




 As our new Designer at frog, you have a couple of years of experience in designing new digital products and services using human-centered design practices. You understand the importance of user experience and can articulate how your design decisions support that. You are passionate about solving design challenges together with a team of other creatives, designers, and developers, and strive to deliver useful, user-friendly, and excellent work.
 



  





 In this role you will play a key role in:
 


* Partnering with leading organizations and multidisciplinary teams to solve real business challenges, develop strategies, design new business models, and implement solutions that drive measurable impact and long-term growth.
* Bringing bold ideas to life – from concept to execution by working at the intersection for creativity, strategy and technology.
* Being a part of a collaborative and vibrant community where design, data and business insight come together to reimagine customer experiences and drive lasting transformation.



  





**YOUR PROFILE** 



* A University degree in a relevant design or behavioral science discipline- such as Service Design, Digital Design, User Experience Design, Product Design, or Interaction Design- combined with hands-on experience.
* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English.
* Minimum
 **4+ years of relevant full time working experience** 
 in a variety of organizations (start-up, corporate, agency/consultancy) and have had roles such as Service Designer, Art Director, UX Designer, or Product Designer.
* Strong portfolio showcasing digital design work, including wireframes, prototypes, and UI designs. You are proficient in design tools such as Figma, Sketch or Adobe XD and you have a solid understanding of user-centered design principles and accessibility best practices.
* Experience of generative AI design tools and working with motion, 3D design, front-end developers, design systems and component libraries is meriting



  





**WHAT YOU’LL LOVE ABOUT WORKING HERE?** 



* **Learning & Development:** 
 A key focus of the Accelerate Programme is placed on your development and providing you with opportunities to learn a variety of skills in a range of environments. You will benefit from a suite of learning opportunities, including a dedicated WfO Academy curriculum from internal trainings to externally recognized professional accreditations.
* **Flexibility & Autonomy:** 
 You are free to make your role and your career what you want it to be. Proactivity and ambition flourish at Capgemini Invent. Our hybrid policy enables us to have one of the best scores for work-life balance on Glassdoor - giving you the chance to work from home, in the office, and sometimes abroad.
* **Global Connection:** 
 Network with our global community through a variety of our award-winning programs, such as InventX and Invent Director Excellence, as well as other various local employee networks to express your uniqueness and find like-minded people.



  





**NEED TO KNOW** 





 Start date and location
 




 You’ll join our Stockholm office in Fall 2026, ready to travel and work on projects at our client sites.
 



  






 Application process
 




 We review applications on an ongoing basis, so apply early to secure your spot. Please submit your CV in English along with your official high school and university transcripts. When applying through the system, upload these documents under “Cover Letter.” Since there is only one upload field for grades, we kindly ask you to merge your high school, bachelor’s, and master’s transcripts into a single document before uploading.
 



  





 As part of your application, also include either a link or a PDF of your portfolio showcasing recent work. Your portfolio should highlight your skills and experience relevant to the role, with clear examples of how you work, think, collaborate, and contribute to successful design outcomes. Please note that applications without a portfolio cannot be considered, as incomplete applications will not be reviewed.
 



  





*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be conducted through inspection of your ID card, and background checks may be carried out as required* 




  






 Next steps
 




 Our selection process includes several steps to ensure a fair and thorough evaluation:
 


* CV & grade screening
* Phone interview
* Video interview
* On-site case
* Final interview
* Offer



  





**ABOUT CAPGEMINI** 




 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry.
 



  





*#LI-DNI*

title: Business Arena CX Lead to CIB CIO | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Do you want to be part of shapinghow some of the Nordics’ largestcompanies andcorporates interact with their bank? SEB is looking for a CX Lead to drive the customer experience in our proprietary bank portal, Business Arena.
   

  

 SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fuelled by collaboration. At the same time,we’rea leading financial services group in northern Europe, serving a wide spectrum of clients from small companies to large corporates and financial institutions.
