title: Platform DevOps Engineer
description:
**The Wow** 

 As a Platform DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and operating critical platform services that power our applications and customer experiences. This includes managing and optimizing our CDN, Cloud Edge functions, DNS, WAF, and IIS-based applications, while ensuring high availability, scalability, and security across our environments.
 



 You will bring deep technical expertise in AWS cloud services, infrastructure as code, and automation tooling, with a focus on enabling reliable, performant, and secure delivery of applications at the edge. Collaboration with developers, security engineers, and infrastructure teams will be essential to align platform capabilities with organizational goals.
 



 Your contributions will directly support our vision to transition workloads from on-premise infrastructure to modern, cloud-native and edge-optimized platforms.
 


 Product Development at Betsson Group
 
 Our Product Development organisation is truly Global with cross functional teams spanning 6 Tech Hubs – Malta, Budapest, Stockholm, Tallinn, Kyiv and Athens. With nearly 600 strong professionals, the Product Development organisation is spear-headed by our CTO-CPO with all our talented Area Teams working together.
 


 A taster of what you will be involved with
 * Platform Ownership – Manage and optimize CDN, DNS, WAF, edge functions (NodeJS), and IIS applications, ensuring high reliability, security, and performance.
* Cloud & Infrastructure as Code – Design, implement, and maintain infrastructure using Terraform, with a focus on scalability, repeatability, and GitOps best practices.
* Automation & Configuration Management – Build automation workflows using Ansible, and Git to improve deployment velocity and reduce manual effort.
* Cloud Native Transformation – Support the organization’s shift from on-premise to AWS cloud-native workloads, introducing edge-first strategies where appropriate.
* Kubernetes Integration – Collaborate with container platform teams to integrate workloads with Kubernetes where needed, ensuring seamless connectivity with edge services.
* Collaboration & Guidance – Work closely with developers, architects, and security engineers to integrate WAF, CDN, and DNS changes into CI/CD pipelines and delivery processes.
* Monitoring & Reliability – Define and track metrics, logs, and traces across platform services to proactively detect issues, optimize performance, and improve resilience.
* Continuous Improvement – Stay current with industry trends in cloud, CDN, and edge technologies; recommend and implement best practices to evolve the platform.


 You're good at
 * Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience, technical degree beneficial.
* AWS Cloud practitioner or higher would be beneficial.
* Proven hands-on experience with
	+ AWS services (CloudFront, Lambda@Edge, Route 53, WAF, EC2, S3, IAM, etc.)
	+ Infrastructure as Code (Terraform)
	+ Git/GitOps workflows
	+ Kubernetes (good understanding, with ability to integrate workloads)
	+ Configuration management (Ansible)
	+ IIS application management
	+ Scripting (JavaScript/NodeJS preferred)
* Strong understanding of platform reliability, networking fundamentals (DNS, CDN routing, edge services), and application delivery.
* Experience in implementing secure, scalable, and automated infrastructure solutions.
* Knowledge of observability pillars (logs, metrics, tracing) and proactive monitoring practices.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, adapting to new technologies and evolving requirements.
* Familiarity with DevOps principles and ITIL best practices is a plus.
* Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyse complex technical issues and provide effective solutions in a timely manner.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, vendors, and partners.


 Who We Are
 
 Betsson Group is one of the largest companies within the Global iGaming space and can trace our heritage as far back as the 1960’s. We’re Swedish and publicly listed too with our Operational HQ located on the Mediterranean Island of Malta.
 



 We strive to deliver the best customer experience in the industry. As a market leader within iGaming we offer online gaming products across 12+ jurisdictions and 20+ brands.
 



 You will be part of a passionate team, which is building an industry leading, scalable, multi-brand platform used by hundreds of thousands of our customers!
 


 What we offer
 

 Much like a rollercoaster, life at Betsson Group is fast-paced, full of twists and turns, and always exciting. With more than
 **2,800** 
 colleagues representing over 75 nationalities
 **across a global network of offices** 
 - including
 **1,500** 
 at our operational headquarters in Malta - every day brings new challenges and opportunities to grow. It may not be for the faint-hearted, but if you thrive on innovation, enjoy pushing boundaries and want to be part of a diverse, international team, then you’ll fit right in at Betsson.
   

  


 We offer numerous challenges where your skills will be put to good use! We encourage innovation, independence and celebrate success where you will be part of multi-cultural and diverse company, with people from all over the world.
   

  




 Challenge Accepted?
 
***By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy***

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
*Vi utmanar de traditionella konsultbolagen och vi kan med stolthet säga att Castra är konsultbranschens mest utvecklande arbetsplats där allt är möjligt. Känns det här som företaget för dig så läs gärna vidare.*
**Rollen**
 I rollen som DevOps Engineer kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att optimera och automatisera våra kunders utvecklings- och driftsprocesser.
   

  

**I rollen kommer du:**
* Designa, implementera och underhålla CI/CD-pipelines.
* Automatisera driftsättningar och infrastrukturer med hjälp av verktyg som Ansible, Terraform, eller liknande.
* Säkerställa systemens säkerhet, prestanda och tillgänglighet.
* Samarbeta med utvecklingsteam för att identifiera och lösa problem snabbt och effektivt.
* Implementera och övervaka loggning och övervakningssystem för att säkerställa proaktiv drift.


**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Erfarenhet av DevOps-metoder och verktyg.
* Erfarenhet av Linux
* Stark kompetens i molntjänster som AWS, Azure, eller Google Cloud.
* Erfarenhet av containerteknologier som Docker och Kubernetes.
* Kunskap i skript- och programmeringsspråk som Python, Bash, eller liknande.
* Förståelse för versioneringssystem som Git.
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och i team, med stark problemlösningsförmåga.


**Meriterande:**
* Certifieringar inom molntjänster (AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, Azure DevOps Engineer, etc.).
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila miljöer.


**Bara det bästa åt de bästa – vår personalfilosofi**
 Castra är en konsultgrupp inom IT och Management. Eller ja, en elite squad kan man säga. Vi samlar de vassaste och mest erfarna konsulterna, helt enkelt för att det är hos oss de får ut max i både kapacitet och livskvalitet. Vi är verksamma inom Systemutveckling, IT-infrastruktur, IT-styrning & Ledarskap samt IT-säkerhet.
   

  

 Vi är Sveriges bästa arbetsplats, på riktigt! Det låter lite skrytsamt, men det är faktiskt inte vi som sagt det. Castra har sedan 2017 blivit certifierad av
 **Great Place to Work** 
 och har de senaste två åren blivit utnämnda till
 **Sveriges Bästa Arbetsplats** 
 för stora bolag. Som grädde på moset är vi även ett Gasell- och Karriärföretag. Vi blev även 2025 utnämnda till
 **Europas Bästa Arbetsplats.**
 På Castra tror vi på frihet, utveckling och gemenskap. Du som konsult styr själv vilka uppdrag du tar, när du jobbar, om du vill levla upp någon kompetens och hur och mycket lön och semester du tar ut. Att du får bygga din egen logga är bara en bonus! Trodde du det var allt? Då trodde du fel. Stöd av bra chefer, aktiviteter, kompetent och snabbfotad säljstyrka, möjlighet till delägarskap, stora möjligheter att påverka bolagets framtid och härliga kollegor – listan på vad som gör Castra till en fantastisk arbetsplats kan göras lååång. Möjligheterna bra nära oändliga. Win för alla parter, säger vi.
   

  

*Castra har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro, Jönköping och Sundsvall.*
 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss på castra.se/konsulterbjudande/
   

  

**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?**
**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?** 
 Sök direkt via länken eller kontakta Charlotta.Ljung@@castra.se Tfn: 072-871 63 12

title: Lumera Test Lead – Fund Trading
description:
**Company Description**
 We are a consulting company with a bunch of tech-savvy and happy people!
   

  

 We love technology, we love design, and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where every individual is highly valued.
   

  

 With us, everyone can be themselves while respecting others for who they are. We believe that when an amazing mix of people come together and share their knowledge, experiences, and ideas, we can help our clients on a completely different level.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who can start immediately and wants to grow with us!
   

  

 With us, you have great opportunities to make real progress in your career and the chance to take on significant responsibility.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The assignment involves ensuring that the fund execution functionality meets both technical and business requirements through well-structured and well-documented test cases. A key focus will be to elevate the organisation’s ability to write, structure, and manage test cases in Jira (XRAY) through hands-on coaching, collaboration, and practical guidance.
   

  

 The organisation is currently implementing a new Lumera core system, and one of the main challenges is that internal teams understand fund trading—but not how fund trading works inside Lumera. The Test Lead will therefore play a central role in bridging this gap: initially by writing and executing test cases themselves and, as competence grows, by coaching others across the business to take ownership.
   

  

 In this role you will work closely with Lumera specialists, test automation engineers, and business stakeholders to ensure that test cases are fit for purpose, structured for automation, and aligned with the overall test strategy. The organisation already has a Test Lead, Test Strategist, and automation capabilities in place, but additional expertise is needed to build out the structure, clarify flows, and strengthen the test process within the Lumera implementation.
   

  

 For this assignment the resource needs to act as the expert from day one.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Deep experience of Lumera and its fund trading module.
* Strong experience in writing and managing test cases in Jira (XRAY) or similar test management tools.
* Proven ability to teach and coach others through hands-on, practical guidance.
* A strong understanding of how test cases should be structured to enable automation.
* Swedish and English language skills.


**Meritorious Qualifications**
* Experience supporting teams during transitions to new core systems.
* Ability to visualise and map fund execution flows to support testing and automation.


**Preferred Soft Skills For Success**
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to build trust and help others feel confident using new tools and processes.
* A proactive and collaborative mindset.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work hands-on in a complex transformation environment.
* Confidence stepping into an expert role and guiding others who may be less familiar with Lumera.


 Additional Information
   

  

**Start date:** 
 ASAP
   

  

**Mode of Work:** 
 Flexible, 3 days on site
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment.
   

  

 We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.

title: Senior Fullstackutvecklare / Tech Lead till Liminity
description:
**Liminity är mitt i en spännande tillväxtresa med allt fler projekt och kunder. Nu söker vi en tech lead
 **till vårt interna utvecklingsteam** 
 som trivs lika bra med att koda som att coacha.**
 Vad du kommer göra
   

  

 Du kommer koda, utforma tekniska lösningar, reviewea och samtidigt coacha våra mer juniora kollegor. Projekten varierar – ena veckan bygger du en AI-integration, nästa vecka är det en Power Apps lösning eller en ny feature i en fullstack-applikation.
   

  

 Vår teknikstack
   

  

* Frontend: Next.js, React, TypeScript, Tailwind
* Backend: FastAPI, Python, PostgreSQL
* Plattformar: Microsoft 365, Azure
* DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD
* Test: Jest, Pytest, Playwright

 Vem vi söker
   

  

* Flera års erfarenhet som fullstackutvecklare
* Stark i TypeScript och moderna JavaScript-ramverk (gärna Next.js/React)
* Erfarenhet av Python och FastAPI
* Erfarenhet av att bygga integrationer mellan olika system och tjänster
* Van att leda eller mentorera andra utvecklare

**Meriterande:**
* Erfarenhet av LangChain eller liknande AI-ramverk
* Erfarenhet av Power Platform
* Bidragit till open source

title: Tech Lead Manager to Sinch
description:
*Are you seeking a role that perfectly balances deep, hands-on technical work with impactful people leadership?* 




  





**About the job** 




 This is a direct recruitment, which means that the recruitment process takes place through Bravura and you are employed directly by Sinch.
 



  





**About the company** 




 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch’s Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
 



  





 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
 



  





 At Sinch we “Dream Big”, “Win Together”, “Keep it simple”, and “Make it Happen”. These values are our foundation!
 



  





**Tasks and responsibilities** 




 Sinch is seeking a Tech Lead Manager to guide their In-App Calling team. This is a unique 50/50 hybrid role where you will lead a full-stack team responsible for the critical client-side SDKs and backend services that enable seamless in-app voice and video calling within our customers' applications. You will be instrumental in shaping our technical landscape and fostering the growth of our people.
 



  





 You will be empowered to drive excellence across two key areas:
 



  





**As a People Leader (50%):** 



* Cultivate a high-trust, inclusive engineering culture through dedicated coaching, continuous feedback, and personalised career development plans for each team member.
* Define clear team objectives, remove obstacles, and ensure your team is motivated, engaged, and aligned with our strategic goals.
* Champion a collaborative environment where continuous learning and shared ownership are paramount.



  





**As a Hands-On Engineer (50%):** 



* Dedicate half your time to designing, coding, and delivering features for our core backend services, leveraging your expertise in technologies like .NET.
* Lead by example in code reviews, architectural discussions, and by evangelizing best practices in software craftsmanship.
* Actively contribute to and improve our DevOps culture, including our CI/CD pipelines, Infrastructure as Code, and Kubernetes deployments.



  





**Education, experience and personal characteristics** 



* Deep Technical Extensive hands-on experience in backend development with a history of building scalable, production-grade systems on cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
* Demonstrable experience in a formal or informal leadership capacity (e.g., as a manager, team lead, or senior mentor) and a genuine desire to help engineers grow their careers.
* The ability to articulate complex technical ideas clearly in English, build consensus, and inspire a team toward a common goal.
* A Servant-Leader Mindset: You are proactive, collaborative, and view your primary role as enabling your team to do its best work.



  





**What Success Looks Like** 



* **Within** 
 3 Months, You'll... have built strong relationships with your team, shipped your first significant piece of code, and established a solid partnership with your Product Manager to align on the roadmap.
* **Within** 
 6 Months, You'll... be leading the delivery of a key team project, have established a cadence of meaningful career conversations, and be driving an initiative to improve your team's technical operations.
* **Within** 
 1 Year, You'll... be a trusted and indispensable leader, having demonstrably improved both your team's health and the quality of its technical deliverables while contributing to the strategic roadmap.



  





**Other information** 




**Start:** 
 Upon agreement
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm
 



**Salary:** 
 Upon agreement
 



  





 We use a competency-based method in all recruitment processes to ensure unbiased selection. We also work with ongoing selection, which means that we’ll take down the job ad when enough candidates have reached the final steps of the process.
 



  





 If you are considered for the position, we will contact you for an initial interview. Regardless of whether you proceed in the process or not, you will receive feedback on your application.
 



 If you have questions about the service or about your application, you are welcome to contact our support by emailing info@bravura.se or calling 010-171 47 10 and we will help you. Please indicate which service it applies to.
 



  





 We recommend that you submit your application immediately as we make a continuous selection.
 



  





 Welcome with your application!

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Dometic is a global leader in outdoor living solutions, providing essential gear for an adventurous lifestyle. We are on an exciting growth and transformation journey – now looking for our next star – a passionate Data Engineer who will help us advance our global data platform and drive adoption across the organization.
   

  

**About The Position**
**As a** 
**Data Engineer** 
 in the Data & AI Office, you will help develop and scale our Snowflake-based data platform. You’ll work with global teams and senior stakeholders to turn business needs into robust, scalable solutions – designing integrations, optimizing pipelines, and shaping architectural standards as the platform evolves.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities**
* Design and develop data pipelines and workflows
* Set up and manage integrations between source systems and the data platform
* Identify and map source system information
* Handle incidents and ensure data quality
* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver scalable solutions


**What do we offer?**
 You are offered an interesting role in a dynamic, fast paced and global environment with great opportunities to grow, evolve with the company and take on new challenges.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**A suitable background would be** 
 at least 5 years' experience from analytical solutions or platforms. You have a solid experience within data engineering and analytics – and you are most likely coming from a consulting background, now ready to take the next step: join a global company, lead initiatives, and make a long-term impact. You also have the following qualifications and experiences:
   

  

* Strong SQL and data modeling skills
* Experience in driving or leading projects (formal PM experience not required)
* Beneficial: Snowflake, Python, Azure platform, Azure DevOps, PowerShell
* You are fluent in reading, writing and speaking English. Bilingual in Swedish is a plus


**To be successful in this role, we believe that you possess the following skills, competencies & characteristics:**
* Curious and eager to learn new technologies while understanding the bigger business context
* Analytical with strong ability to connect the dots and see patterns
* Strategic thinker who can scale solutions and drive improvements
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
* Strong business acumen and ability to build trust across teams


**Dometic's Core Values**
 To thrive and succeed in this role, you understand the importance of our core values – Together We build our future, We play to win, We embrace change and We walk the talk; these values reflect the heart and soul of Dometic and they define what it takes to work here and how we do things.
   

  

 Dometic operates with a 4+1 policy, 4 days per week in the office and the possibility to work 1 day per week remotely. We see the social aspect of being in the office, meeting colleagues, having short coffee break interactions or a quick face to face meeting as key to success as we become more productive and fast paced in terms of problem solving, learning, cross functional collaboration and not the least in a way to have fun at work!
   

  

**Are you our next star?** 
 Then we would love to see your application. Selection is being made on a running basis. If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Anna Allert, Talent Acquisition at anna.allert@dometic.com
   

  

 In this recruitment, personality and logical test will be used as part of the process.

title: Senior Java Developer – 14667
description:
**🚀 We're #Hiring: Senior #Java #Developer** 




  




**📌 Eligibility** 

 Only applicants who
 **live in Sweden** 
 and hold a
 **valid work visa or work permit** 
 will be considered.
 



  





 We’re looking for an
 **experienced Java Developer** 
 to join an exciting new project building a modern application for store personnel. This solution will transform how item data is searched, sorted, and managed — ultimately streamlining daily workflows across our stores.
 



 You’ll join a
 **small, high-collaboration team** 
 of internal developers and consultants, working together with strong focus on quality, communication, and delivery excellence.
 



 Our tech stack is built on
 **modern Java and Azure** 
 , and the project involves close coordination with other development teams within an
 **agile SAFe environment** 
 .
 



  





**What you will work on:** 



* Develop modern Java-based backend solutions for a new application aimed at improving how store staff search, sort, and manage item information.
* Build and maintain Spring Boot microservices designed around REST/OData APIs.
* Work hands-on with Azure Cloud technologies and contribute to environment setup, configuration, and optimization.
* Collaborate closely with a small cross-functional team of consultants and in-house developers, as well as other development teams within the organization.
* Implement integrations with external systems and ensure robust data flows across services.
* Contribute to improving performance and optimizing the existing codebase.
* Participate in agile development activities within a SAFe-based framework.
* Write and maintain high-quality unit and integration tests to ensure reliability and maintainability.
* Support containerization and orchestration workflows using Docker and Kubernetes.



**What you bring:** 



* Extensive experience working with Azure Cloud technologies and environment management.
* Strong background in developing Spring Boot microservices using REST/OData API architectures.
* Excellent proficiency in Java 17 or later.
* Solid understanding of databases, with hands-on experience in SQL/PostgreSQL.
* Proven experience writing unit and integration tests.
* Good knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes.
* Experience working with external integrations in complex environments.
* Strong skills in optimizing and improving performance within codebases.
* Familiarity with agile ways of working and tools such as Jira.
* Very good command of English; Swedish is an advantage.
* Meritorious experience in DevOps, CI/CD, and Azure-based pipelines, SAP ERP/S4HANA, and retail environments handling item master data



  





 #Hiring #JavaDeveloper #Azure #SwedenJobs #SpringBoot #Microservices #DevOps #Kubernetes #PostgreSQL #SAFe #Agile #CloudJobs #TechJobsSweden #DeveloperJobs #RetailTech

title: Database Engineer PostgreSQL
description:
Vi söker en erfaren Database Engineer med stark kompetens inom
 **PostgreSQL** 
 för ett långsiktigt uppdrag inom en organisation med mycket höga krav på tillgänglighet, säkerhet och compliance. Rollen är central i kundens pågående transformationsresa där målet är att modernisera databastjänster och bygga en robust, skalbar plattform för framtiden.
   

  

 Konsulten arbetar på plats i Stockholm, i en tekniskt komplex miljö med fokus på säker drift och kontinuerlig utveckling.
   

  

**Uppdragsbeskrivning / arbetsuppgifter**
 Konsulten kommer att ha ett helhetsansvar för PostgreSQL som tjänst – från installation och konfiguration till livscykelhantering, säkerhetskopiering, återställning och förbättringsarbete.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter Inkluderar**
* Drift och vidareutveckling av PostgreSQL i miljöer med höga krav på tillgänglighet och säkerhet
* Ansvar för installation, uppgraderingar, patchning och optimering
* Arbete med High Availability-lösningar och klustermiljöer
* Hantering av nätverkskommunikation inklusive TLS
* Automatisering av processer (t.ex. med Ansible och CI/CD)
* Samarbete med DevOps- och utvecklingsteam för att säkerställa compliant och stabil tjänsteleverans
* Bidra till vidareutveckling av plattformen i samband med kundens transformationsdrift
* Dokumentation, incidenthantering och rotorsaksanalyser


**Skallkrav**
* Gedigen erfarenhet av PostgreSQL i drift- och plattformsorienterade roller
* Erfarenhet av arbetssätt och arkitekturer med höga krav på tillgänglighet
* God förståelse för:
+ High Availability
+ Klustermiljöer
+ TLS och nätverkskommunikation

* Erfarenhet av automatisering, t.ex. via Ansible, CI/CD
* Teknisk förståelse för Kubernetes och meshnätverk
* Erfarenhet av Linux-baserade miljöer
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska
* Möjlighet att genomgå säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av härdning av Linuxsystem enligt CIS Benchmarks
* Erfarenhet av att bygga och drifta plattformar i Kubernetes
* Erfarenhet av meshnätverk och tjänstenätverk i containeriserade miljöer
* Erfarenhet från reglerade eller säkerhetsklassade verksamheter


**Personliga egenskaper**
* Analytisk och strukturerad
* Hög problemlösningsförmåga och stark leveransförmåga
* Kommunikativ och samarbetsorienterad
* Trivs i en föränderlig och tekniskt avancerad miljö
* Nyfiken, engagerad och bidrar till plattformens långsiktiga utveckling


**Start:** 
 2026-02-01 eller enligt överenskommelse
   

  

**Slut:** 
 2026-09-30, möjlighet till förlängning
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 100 %, kontorstid 08:00–17:00
   

  

**Plats:** 
 På plats i Stockholm (Technology Operations / Infrastructure Services)

title: Forskningsassistent med programmeringskunskaper
description:
**Psykologiska institutionen** 
 är en kreativ och internationell arbetsplats för utbildning och forskning med ca 200 anställda. Över 1000 personer studerar på våra olika utbildningar, på allt från grundnivå till forskarnivå, inklusive psykologprogram, psykoterapeutprogram och specialistutbildningar.
   

  

 Vi bedriver också mycket framgångsrik forskning inom flera områden, bland annat inom arbets- och organisationspsykologi, psykofysik och perception, stress, biologisk psykologi, klinisk psykologi, kognition, socialpsykologi och utvecklingspsykologi. Institutionen har en egen psykologisk klinik för forskning och utbildning med ca 4000 besök per år.
   

  

 Mer information om oss finns på: Psykologiska institutionen.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Sensory Cognitive Interaction Laboratory (SCI-LAB) är en ledande forskargrupp som innefattar ett dussintals medarbetare och som leds av Professor Jonas Olofsson. Vi söker en forskningsassistent med programmeringskunskaper till ett projekt om rumsligt minne. I projektet får deltagare komma ihåg platser för lukt, ljud, eller bild i virtual reality miljö. Forskningsassistentens huvudsakliga uppgifter är att hjälpa till med vidareutvecklingen av den befintliga VR-mjukvaran. Utöver arbetsuppgifterna inom minnespelutvecklingen tillkommer andra programmeringsrelaterade arbetsuppgifter i andra projekt i labbet.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 Vi letar efter sökanden med en kandidatexamen i datorspelsutveckling. Du ska ha god kunskap inom programmering och vara intresserad av att arbeta med detta inom ramen för perceptionsforskning. Det är viktigt att du är välorganiserad, noggrann och arbetar bra som del i en grupp. Vi söker någon med en data- och systemvetenskaplig utbildningsbakgrund inom programmering (C#, C++, Blueprint), speldesign (Unity, Unreal Engine), och grundläggande mjukvarudokumentering (t ex Git, Github, Fork). Personen bör ha god social förmåga, vara engagerad i arbetet och kunna arbeta självständigt. För anställningen är dokumenterad erfarenhet av spelutveckling meriterande. Av stor vikt i anställningen är att kunna hitta praktiska lösningar på komplexa problem.
   

  

 Om anställningen
   

  

 Anställningen avser halvtid (50 %) och är tidsbegränsad till sex månader. Stockholms universitet tillämpar individuell lönesättning. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder
   

  

 Hos oss får du dynamiken i samspelet mellan högre utbildning och forskning som gör Stockholms universitet till en spännande och kreativ miljö. Du arbetar i en internationell miljö och får förmånliga villkor. Universitetet ligger beläget i Nationalstadsparken med goda förbindelser till city. Psykologiska institutionen bedriver sin verksamhet på campus Albano.
   

  

 Stockholms universitet värnar om att vara en arbetsplats som är fri från diskriminering och ger lika rättigheter och möjligheter för alla.
   

  

 Kontakt
   

  

 Ytterligare information lämnas av projektledare Malina Szychowska, malina.szychowska@psychology.su.se.
   

  

 Ansökan
   

  

 Du söker anställningen via Stockholms universitets rekryteringssystem. Du som sökande ansvarar för att ansökan är komplett och att den är universitetet tillhanda senast sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 Anvisningar för sökande finns på webbsidan: att söka en anställning.
   

  

 Stockholms universitet bidrar till det hållbara demokratiska samhällets utveckling genom kunskap, upplysning och sanningssökande.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tidsbegränsad anställning | Anställningens omfattning: deltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 50 % | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: SU FV-4411-25 | Facklig företrädare: ST/OFR st@st.su.se, Saco-S saco@saco.su.se, Seko sekodirekt@seko.se, | Publicerat: 2025-12-08 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-12-22

title: Senior Backendutvecklare (.NET/Java)
description:
På TechSeed tror vi att framtiden byggs av människor som vågar tänka längre — och av tekniken som gör det möjligt. Världen förändras snabbare än någonsin, och behovet av att kombinera affärsförståelse, digitalt ledarskap och innovativa arbetssätt med nästa generations teknik har aldrig varit större.
   

  

 Vi befinner oss i en tid där
 **AI, XR, digitala tvillingar, IoT och uppkopplade ekosystem** 
 omformar företag, industrier och hela samhällen. För oss är det här inte bara tekniska trender — det är kärnan i vårt uppdrag och den framtid vi redan bygger tillsammans med våra kunder.
   

  

 TechSeed växer snabbt, och vi växer smart. Som medarbetarägt bolag formar vi själva våra satsningar och driver utvecklingen inom våra tre strategiska domäner:
   

  

* Smart Things – intelligenta produkter, uppkopplade system och IoT-lösningar
* Smart Industry – digitala tvillingar, avancerad automation och data­driven industri
* Smart Society – hållbar offentlig sektor, energi- och samhällssystem förstärkta av AI


 Här skapar vi lösningar där teknik och människa möts — från idé till verklig påverkan. Det här är vår arena. Det här är vårt
 *why* 
 . Och det är det som fyller oss med energi, varje dag.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Vi söker en eller flera
 **Seniora Backendutvecklare** 
 som vill vara en del av vårt kärnteam och bidra till att bygga framtidens lösningar i skärningspunkten mellan engineering, AI, data och framtida upplevelser.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta nära arkitekter, AI-ingenjörer, designers och våra XR-partners. Rollen passar dig som gillar att lösa komplexa problem och bygga skalbara system som gör verklig skillnad.
   

  

* Utveckla robusta backend-tjänster i .NET eller Java
* Designa API:er, integrationer och molnbaserade komponenter
* Säkerställa skalbarhet, säkerhet och kvalitet tillsammans med arkitekter
* Samarbeta med AI-teamet för att integrera intelligenta funktioner
* Bidra i prototyper inom AI/XR/data-visualisering
* Delta i kunddialoger och behovsanalys
* Påverka tekniska riktlinjer och arbetssätt


**Vem söker vi**
* 5+ års erfarenhet av backendutveckling
* Goda kunskaper i Azure eller annan molnplattform
* Van vid integrationer, API:er och distribuerade system
* Nyfiken på AI, data och framtida gränssnitt
* Strukturerad, lösningsorienterad och samarbetsinriktad
* Trivs i team med hög kompetens och låg prestige
* Flytande i engelska och svenska
* Tidigare konsulterfarenhet


 Hos oss blir du en del av ett litet, senior team i en tidig fas — men med tydlig ambition att växa snabbt inom ett av Sveriges mest expansiva konsultbolag. Du får arbeta i skärningspunkten mellan modern engineering, AI och framtidens upplevelser, och får stort utrymme att påverka riktning, kultur och hur vi bygger teamet framåt.
   

  

**Om TechSeed**
 TechSeed är ett medarbetarägt konsultbolag i snabb tillväxt, där vi bygger framtiden tillsammans. Hos oss får du både inflytande och ägarskap — på riktigt. Vi tror på nära samarbeten, nyfikenhet och modet att skapa lösningar som gör skillnad inom
 **Smart Things, Smart Industry och Smart Society** 
 .
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en kultur där människor och teknik får utrymme att utvecklas, där idéer tas tillvara och där en stark gemenskap gör det naturligt att växa tillsammans. Som en del av TechSeed får du:
   

  

* Delägarskap och bonus kopplat till bolagets framgång
* Stort inflytande i hur vi formar vår studio och vårt erbjudande
* En öppen, inkluderande kultur där vi utvecklas och lär av varandra
* Möjligheten att växa in i nya teknikområden och ansvarsroller
* Flexibla arbetssätt som fungerar med uppdrag och vardag
* 5 000 kr i friskvård
* Hälsoförsäkring


 Om du vill vara med och utveckla ett snabbt växande bolag, nära tekniken och med stort utrymme att påverka — då vill vi gärna träffa dig.

title: Pega Certified Lead System Architect
description:
Permanent Employment – Sweden
   

  

 Experience Level: 10+ years in Pega development
   

  

**Job Summary**
 We are seeking a highly experienced Pega Certified Lead System Architect (CLSA) with applications built on Pega Constellation architecture. The ideal candidate will have deep experience in Pega platform capabilities, particularly with Constellation UX, and will work closely with stakeholders, developers, and architects to translate business requirements into end-to-end solutions.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead the design and development of Pega applications using Pega Constellation and latest features of Pega Infinity.
* Collaborate with business analysts and stakeholders to ensure alignment between Blueprint models and Pega implementations.
* Define high-level architecture and design patterns for Pega solutions.
* Provide technical leadership and mentorship to development teams.
* Ensure adherence to Pega best practices and coding standards.
* Participate in all phases of the SDLC including design, development, testing, and deployment.
* Create and maintain technical documentation.
* Troubleshoot and resolve performance issues and bugs.


**Required Skills & Qualifications**
* Pega CLSA Certification (mandatory).
* Extensive experience with latest Pega (minimum 8.x) platform.
* Hands-on experience with Blueprint for process modelling and requirement gathering.
* Expertise in Pega Constellation, Case Management, workflow, and Integration.
* Strong understanding of object-oriented programming and design principles.
* Experience with Agile methodologies and tools like JIRA.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Experience with Pega DevOps and CI/CD pipelines.
* Knowledge of Pega DX API and UI/UX best practices.
* Knowledge of emerging PEGA GenAI Features
* Exposure to cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
* Knowledge of Pega frameworks (CS / KYC ) or CDH is a plus


**About Cognizant**
 Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 194 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.

title: Regulatory Specialist
description:
**Regulatory Associate - Pagero**

Are you ready to tackle the complexities of global regulatory compliance and drive innovation in e-invoicing and tax technology? As a member of the Regulatory Affairs team, you can be a part of our journey as the global leader in invoicing compliance.


Pagero has recently joined Thomson Reuters. Together, we are building the world’s largest, open business network. With our cloud-based network, customers can reach any business, anywhere in the world – no matter how many borders their operations may cross. We take care of the technical and regulatory requirements across the entire order-to-cash, purchase-to-pay and freight processes, to give customers data accuracy and security, transparency, and real-time visibility. All this through a single connection.


Global regulatory compliance with e-invoicing and CTC (continuous transaction control) mandates presents a formidable and ongoing challenge for multinationals. The landscape of regulations governing indirect tax and the application of tax technologies is expanding but often involves a lack of uniformity among different regulatory bodies. This complexity, fragmentation, and evolving nature of compliance requirements necessitates a dedicated and knowledgeable team.  



  

We are seeking an Associate to join Pagero – Part of Thomson Reuters’ Regulatory Affairs (RA) team. The RA team has been instrumental in Pagero’s successful global expansion, establishing our position as the global leader in e-invoicing and CTC compliance. This role offers a unique opportunity to contribute to a dynamic and critical area of our business, ensuring that we continue to lead and innovate in this essential field.  

  



**About the Role**  

In this opportunity as Regulatory Associate, you will:


* Analyze and investigate requirements and legislation in markets that Pagero plans to enter
* Maintain and monitor up-to-date knowledge of regulatory requirements in markets that Pagero currently supports
* Create compliance related content, including blogs and updates, for internal and external readers
* Collaborate with stakeholders to launch new markets including integration, marketing, delivery, and more departments
* Present Pagero’s compliance solutions and relevant business cases to customers, curated for both technical and c-level audiences
* Address queries from internal and external stakeholders, ranging from simple to complex

**About You**  

You’re a fit for the role of Regulatory Associate if you have the following required qualifications:


* At least 1-3 years of experience in e-invoicing/CTC, tax technology and/or indirect tax.Applicants with legal or compliance experience in digital, privacy and/or security areas, and the readiness to apply that knowledge to digital settings, as well as to learn new skills, will be considered.
* Relevant academic degree: ex. Business, Law, Economics, or similar with relevant work experience
* Fluent in both spoken and written English
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong ability to collaborate effectively within a team environment and document information clearly.
* Proficient with MS Office, comfortable with agentic AI and other planning and visualization tools
* Successfully pass an extended background check (criminal and credit).

Additional preferred qualifications include:


* Knowledge of other languages is highly merited, including French, German, Arabic, Mandarin and more (preferred, but not required)
Experience in ERP, B2B and data integration including solutions such as managed services (preferred, but not required)  
* 

  

#LI-AB3


**What’s in it For You?**

* **Hybrid Work Model:** We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected.
* **Flexibility & Work-Life Balance:** Flex My Way is a set of supportive workplace policies designed to help manage personal and professional responsibilities, whether caring for family, giving back to the community, or finding time to refresh and reset. This builds upon our flexible work arrangements, including work from anywhere for up to 8 weeks per year, empowering employees to achieve a better work-life balance.
* **Career Development and Growth:** By fostering a culture of continuous learning and skill development, we prepare our talent to tackle tomorrow’s challenges and deliver real-world solutions. Our Grow My Way programming and skills-first approach ensures you have the tools and knowledge to grow, lead, and thrive in an AI-enabled future.
* **Industry Competitive Benefits:** We offer comprehensive benefit plans to include flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days off, access to the Headspace app, retirement savings, tuition reimbursement, employee incentive programs, and resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized, award-winning reputation for inclusion and belonging, flexibility, work-life balance, and more. We live by our values: Obsess over our Customers, Compete to Win, Challenge (Y)our Thinking, Act Fast / Learn Fast, and Stronger Together.
* **Social Impact:** Make an impact in your community with our Social Impact Institute. We offer employees two paid volunteer days off annually and opportunities to get involved with pro-bono consulting projects and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives.
* **Making a Real-World Impact:** We are one of the few companies globally that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.


**About Us**

Thomson Reuters informs the way forward by bringing together the trusted content and technology that people and organizations need to make the right decisions. We serve professionals across legal, tax, accounting, compliance, government, and media. Our products combine highly specialized software and insights to empower professionals with the data, intelligence, and solutions needed to make informed decisions, and to help institutions in their pursuit of justice, truth, and transparency. Reuters, part of Thomson Reuters, is a world leading provider of trusted journalism and news.


We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness, and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.


As a global business, we rely on the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of all employees to deliver on our business goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer providing a drug-free workplace.


We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law. More information on requesting an accommodation here .


Learn more on how to protect yourself from fraudulent job postings here .


More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.
company_description: We inform the way forward by delivering trusted content and technology that professionals and institutions need to make the right decisions.

title: Product Data Analyst
description:
**About Us**
============

  

Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.


Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.


Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.


When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 **The role:**  

  

As a **Product Data Analyst** you will be instrumental in driving product decisions through data at Legora. You will analyse user behaviour, measure product performance, and uncover insights that shape our product roadmap. Whilst this is a full-stack data role where you'll build and maintain the analytical infrastructure needed to support your work, the primary focus is on delivering actionable insights that help us build better products for lawyers.


This is a key role that sits at the intersection of product, analytics, and engineering — translating complex data into clear recommendations that drive product strategy. Your work will directly influence how we prioritise features, optimise user experience, and scale our platform.

 **What you will be doing:**

* Analyse product usage patterns, user behaviour, and feature adoption to identify opportunities for improvement and growth.
* Partner closely with Product Managers and designers to define success metrics, design experiments, and measure impact of product initiatives.
* Build and maintain dashboards and automated reporting systems that enable self-service analytics across the product organisation.
* Conduct deep-dive analyses to answer critical product questions and inform strategic decisions.
* Design, build, and maintain data pipelines and data models to support product analytics and reporting needs.

 **Who you are**

* Solid experience in a product analytics, data analyst, or analytics engineering role, ideally in a product-led or SaaS environment.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate ambiguous questions into structured analyses and clear recommendations.
* Proficient in SQL and experienced with modern BI tools; familiarity with Python, dbt, and cloud data warehouses like Snowflake is a plus.
* Understanding of data modelling, ELT best practices, and building analytical systems that are reliable and scalable.
* Experience designing and analysing A/B tests and other product experiments.
* A collaborative, curious mindset with excellent communication skills and the ability to influence product decisions through data storytelling.
* But most importantly, you are someone who


	+ “Gets stuff done” and understands building a $10bn company isn’t always glamorous and takes hard work and long hours
	+ Strives in a fast-paced environment where the answers aren’t always clear and processes are few

**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**


At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Konsultenhetschef inom AI
description:
**Vill du jobba med ledarskap och bidra till affärsutveckling inom AI-området? Combitech i Stockholm söker nu en konsultenhetschef som vill leda vårt innovativa AI-team och samtidigt fortsätta utvecklas i en stödjande miljö. Om du vill forma framtidens AI-lösningar och utveckla dina ledaregenskaper i en kultur som värdesätter samarbete och balans, är detta möjligheten för dig.**

**Vad vi erbjuder**
-------------------


På Combitech får du i din vardag göra skillnad för människor, verksamheter och samhälle. Vi erbjuder spännande utmaningar i det digitaliserade samhällets absoluta framkant. Hos oss får du möjlighet att växa i en företagskultur som uppmuntrar både personlig och professionell utveckling samt trygghet och balans i livet.


Vi tror att man gör ett bättre jobb om man kan fokusera på rätt saker, därför gör vi det lätt att kombinera jobbet med vardagen. Vi satsar på våra medarbetare, de utgör kärnan, hjärnan och hjärtat i vår verksamhet. Dessutom står vi på en stadig grund av högteknologi, forskning och anställningstrygghet med försvars- och säkerhetskoncernen Saab som ägare.

**Vad rollen innebär**
----------------------


Som konsultenhetschef inom affärsområde Applied Analytics leder du ett team av engagerade medarbetare på vårt kontor i Stockholm och bidrar till att utveckla våra spetskompetenser samt utforma våra tjänster inom AI.


I rollen som konsultenhetschef kommer du, utöver att leda din enhet, även att arbeta som konsult i uppdrag. Det ger dig möjlighet att behålla närheten till tekniken samtidigt som du utvecklas som ledare. Rollen innebär också att du får möjlighet att bidra till affärsutveckling och kunddialoger – där du kan identifiera och utveckla idéer och affärsmöjligheter som skapar värde inom AI-området. Du har chansen att bygga och upprätthålla starka kundrelationer, och ditt strategiska tänkande kan bidra till att forma och implementera affärsstrategier som främjar vår tillväxt och innovation.


Applied Analytics är ett relativt nystartat affärsområde inom Combitech som erbjuder AI-lösningar som hjälper våra kunder att effektivisera sina processer, öka sin säkerhet och bidra till ett mer hållbart samhälle. Vi utvecklar också egna innovativa AI-applikationer som kan integreras i kundernas produkter/IT-plattformar eller erbjudas som separata system, exempelvis: Automatiserade mätsystem för kvalitetskontroller baserade på computer vision-teknik samt generativa AI-lösningar baserade på on-prem eller cloud-baserade språkmodeller för granskning, kravanalys, översättning samt sökning i dokument och databaser.

**Då tjänsten innebär arbete som omfattas av försvarssekretess krävs det att du genomför och godkänns i en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll.**

 **Låter det intressant? Skicka in din ansökan direkt! OBS: Urvalet sker efter sista ansökningsdagen.**

**Vad vi söker**
----------------


Vi söker dig som har en teknisk utbildning på högskole- eller universitetsnivå samt har god erfarenhet från yrkeslivet. Vi tror att du har kunskap inom AI och maskininlärning, erfarenhet av att arbeta med teknologier som "computer vision" och generativa AI-modeller, samt förståelse för IT-plattformar och integration av AI-lösningar.


Du trivs i en ledande roll eller ser ledarskap som nästa steg i din karriär. Vi värdesätter personliga egenskaper högt – vi söker en engagerad, lyhörd och inkluderande ledare med ett coachande förhållningssätt. Du har ett genuint intresse för att stödja medarbetare i deras utveckling och är bra på att skapa samarbete över olika avdelningar och med kunder.


Vi tror att du uppskattar att vara med och bygga något nytt tillsammans med dedikerade kollegor. Hos oss är det högt i tak och vi arbetar i en miljö som ständigt förändras med kundernas behov. Vi diskuterar oavbrutet nya tekniker och områden för att kunna hjälpa våra kunder att möta nya utmaningar och förutsättningar. En del av vår strategi är att jobba med att tillföra kunskap och tjänster för ett hållbart och tryggt digitalt samhälle.


Oavsett bransch arbetar samtliga våra kunder med avancerad teknik och drivs av den tekniska utmaningen, något vi hoppas även du gör!

**Rekryterande chef:** Johnny Larsson, johnny.larsson (@) combitech.com

*Vi undanber oss rekryteringssamarbeten.*

title: VMware Engineer
description:
Vill du vara med och forma en helt ny, modern och säker IT-plattform hos en av Sveriges mest samhällsviktiga aktörer? Vi söker nu VMware Engineers till ett omfattande och strategiskt transformationsprojekt där du får en nyckelroll i att utveckla en framtidssäkrad infrastrukturbaserad betalningsplattform.
  
Det här är en unik möjlighet att kliva in i en stor, resursstark organisation med höga krav på stabilitet, driftsäkerhet och säkerhet där din kompetens verkligen gör skillnad.
  
  

**Om rollen:**  

Som VMware Engineer blir du en central del av ett högkompetent team som bygger och etablerar en ny skalbar och modern plattform från grunden. Du arbetar i en avancerad miljö med både on-prem och molnbaserade lösningar, och får stort inflytande över arkitektur, tekniska vägval och hur plattformen utformas långsiktigt.
  
Du kommer in i ett läge där mycket sker samtidigt – modernisering, migrering och nyutveckling – vilket ger dig möjligheten att arbeta både tekniskt djupt och brett.
  
**Dina arbetsuppgifter:** Designa, utveckla, implementera och förvalta VMware-baserade infrastrukturlösningar
  
Bygga, stabilisera och vidareutveckla en helt ny infrastrukturplattform
  
Arbeta med automation, orkestrering och integrationer mellan olika system och tjänster
  
Säkerställa hög tillgänglighet, prestanda och säkerhet i komplexa miljöer
  
Delta i drift, härdning och säkerställande av kritiska infrastrukturfunktioner
  
Samverka tätt med tvärfunktionella team i en organisation med höga tekniska ambitioner
  
Vem är du?
  
Vi söker dig som har djup teknisk kompetens inom virtualisering och VMware – särskilt VMware Cloud Foundation – och som trivs i en miljö där man bygger nytt, förbättrar och skapar struktur längs vägen. Du arbetar metodiskt, värderar kvalitet och har ett starkt intresse för moderna och säkra infrastrukturlösningar.
  
**Kravprofil:** Stark erfarenhet av VMware och virtualiseringsplattformar
  
Erfarenhet av både on-prem och molnbaserade miljöer
  
God förståelse för IT-säkerhet, härdning och drift av affärskritiska system
  
Kunskaper inom Linux
  
Gärna erfarenhet av Kubernetes
  
Erfarenhet av NSX är meriterande
  
Erfarenhet av större, distribuerade och komplexa infrastrukturer är ett plus
  
Varför den här rollen? Möjlighet att arbeta i ett av Sveriges mest omfattande och strategiskt viktiga IT-initiativ
  
Bygga en modern, säker och skalerbar plattform från grunden
  
Jobba långsiktigt och tekniskt djupt i en miljö som värdesätter innovation, kvalitet och samarbete
  
Ta en central roll i ett kompetent team där din expertis verkligen gör skillnad
  
Initialt krävs hög närvaro på plats för att bygga upp drift och struktur, med möjlighet till viss distans längre fram.
  
  

**Om CONSULTING it:**  

När du börjar hos oss som konsult på CONSULTING it blir du en del av vår gemenskap. Du får dessutom kollegor runt om i Sverige! Du har en dedikerad konsultchef som stöttar dig och din utveckling. Vi hjälper dig hitta nya vägar genom att prova på nya roller och nya branscher, för oss är det viktigt att du trivs på din arbetsplats. Vi ser till att du hamnar på ett bra bolag under ditt uppdrag och att uppdragen ligger i linje med hur du vill utvecklas framöver. Oavsett vad det blir, står vi bakom dig hela vägen – i ditt nästa, nästa och nästa steg. Gå med i vårt team och ta del av en spännande och utvecklande arbetsmiljö!

title: JOIN NUDGD AS OUR PRODUCT OWNER! TECH + BEHAVIOR + IMPACT YOU?
description:
Nudgd is a fast-growing tech startup with the ambition to become the world’s leading platform that makes sustainable choices easy. Our team consists of people who want to create measurable impact, and who have a big heart for the environment and sustainability issues. We believe the same goes for you, welcome to our team!
  
At Nudgd, we work in line with Agenda 2030 across a range of sustainability challenges, such as energy, climate, mobility, waste, littering, water, and consumption. Using a combination of behavioral science, sustainability, and technology to create real measurable change, we help companies and municipalities drive behavior change and make sustainable choices easier for citizens, customers, and employees. You can read more about us at nudgd.se
  
About the role
  
We’re now entering the next chapter of our journey, launching version 3.0 of our platform. We are looking for a Product owner to lead our product development and tech strategy forward.
  
As Product owner, you’ll be responsible for leading the development and evolution of Nudgd’s digital products and overall technology. You’ll ensure a secure, scalable, and user-centered platform, while driving innovation in areas like AI, integrations, and digital experiences.
  
You’ll serve as the bridge between technology, market, sales, and customer needs, turning behavioral insights into impactful tech solutions.
  
  

**What makes this role both challenging and exciting:**  

You’re joining us at a phase where we’re growing quickly and shaping a lot along the way. We build together and that will include you. You’ll be responsible for aligning diverse perspectives and balancing multiple priorities in a fast-evolving environment.
  
You’ll need to juggle immediate project needs (like a client-specific feature) with the long-term product strategy and vision. You’ll switch frequently between big-picture and hands-on execution.
  
While you’ll have support, you won’t always have deep technical or product specialists to lean on. This means being hands-on, pragmatic, and resourceful.
  
  

**A glimpse of your daily work:**  

Plan sprints, review sprint progress, prioritize tasks and align with the roadmap.
  
Maintain and evolve the product backlog translate customer insights into new features
  
Explore and apply AI integrations, and new technologies to enhance Nudgd’s digital ecosystems.
  
Development of our online presence, support the development and make sure it aligns with product and goals.
  
Do tests and handle smaller bugs. In an ideal world you will also be able to do some hands-on coding.
  
Collaborate cross-functionally, with the behavioral science, marketing, and sales teams to connect technology with user needs and Nudgd’s mission.
  
  

**We believe that you have:**  

Experience from a similar role (Product owner, Product Lead, Tech lead)
  
A very good understanding of, and eagerness to stay up to date with developments in AI
  
Used to working with , Google Cloud, Git and SQL, with bonus points for experience in Vercel and PHP/Laravel Nova
  
Agile mindset and experience working with iterative development (SCRUM is a plus)
  
A genuine passion for sustainability issues
  
Understanding of user experience and an interest in behavioral design, with a willingness to learn how nudging can improve engagement and impact
  
Strong communicator who connects tech and people
  
Commercially minded, you build products that create value and revenue, not just great tech
  
Are based in Europe
  
Are open to occasional trips with overnight stays
  
  

**You’ll enjoy working with us because:**  

Remote work makes it easier to balance life, and we’re flexible with working hours. We’re a small team of around ten people, which means we’re always close to decision-making, lots of laughs, and a strong sense of shared responsibility.
  
If you value working in a purpose-driven way, you’ve come to the right place. Sustainability is not a side project, it’s at the core of everything we do. And since we base our work on research, the impact we create really makes a difference. If you have any questions, you’re welcome to reach out.
  
We look forward to getting to know you better!
  
/ The team at Nudgd

title: Automotive Penetration Tester
description:
About the Role
  
We are seeking an experienced Automotive Penetration Tester to join our growing cybersecurity engineering team. In this role, you will be responsible for assessing the security of in-vehicle systems, ECUs, automotive communication networks, and connected vehicle services. You will work closely with software developers, security architects, and test teams to identify vulnerabilities, perform penetration testing, and contribute to secure-by-design automotive solutions.
  
This position is ideal for someone who is passionate about vehicle security, hands-on testing, and staying ahead of emerging automotive cyber threats.
  
Key Responsibilities
  
Perform penetration testing, vulnerability assessments, and security evaluations on:
  
ECUs and embedded automotive systems
  
  

In-vehicle networks (CAN, LIN, FlexRay, Ethernet)
  
  

Vehicle connectivity modules (Telematics, Bluetooth, Wi-Fi)
  
  

Mobile apps, backend services, and cloud-connected vehicle platforms
  
Conduct threat analysis and risk assessment (TARA) according to automotive cybersecurity standards.
  
  

Execute fuzzing, reverse engineering, and exploit development for automotive interfaces.
  
  

Analyze and debug communication logs using automotive tools.
  
  

Review code, binaries, and firmware for security weaknesses.
  
  

Prepare clear, detailed reports including findings, severity, and mitigation recommendations.
  
  

Support development teams with secure coding practices and remediation guidance.
  
  

Stay updated on the latest automotive security trends, attack methods, and tools.
  
  

Required Experience & Skills
  
  

**Experience:**  

4–5 years of hands-on penetration testing or automotive cybersecurity experience
  
  

Strong knowledge of automotive EE architecture, ECU communication, and vehicle network behavior
  
  

**Technical Skills:**  

Penetration testing tools
  
Burp Suite, Metasploit, Wireshark, Nmap, Scapy, Nessus, OpenVAS
  
Automotive-specific tools
  
CANoe, CANalyzer, CANtact, CAN-utils, Kayak
  
  

UDS security testing, DoIP testing tools
  
Reverse engineering & debugging
  
IDA Pro, Ghidra, Radare2, Binary Ninja
  
Scripting & automation
  
Python, Bash, PowerShell
  
Protocol knowledge
  
CAN, LIN, FlexRay, Automotive Ethernet, UDS, DoIP, SOME/IP
  
Fuzzing tools
  
AFL, Peach Fuzzer, BooFuzz
  
Operating systems & environments
  
Linux, Android, Embedded Linux, QNX
  
  

Nice-to-Have / Meritorious
  
Experience with ISO 21434, UNECE R155/R156
  
  

Knowledge of secure boot, secure flashing, cryptographic modules
  
  

Automotive SOC experience or work with IDS/IPS for vehicles
  
  

Experience with cloud-based automotive platforms and API security
  
  

**Certifications such as:**  

OSCP, OSWE, CEH, GPEN, CISSP, CPSA, CREST, SSCP
  
Understanding of automotive testing tools like dSPACE, HIL/VIL setups
  
  

Soft Skills
  
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
  
  

Clear communication and documentation skills
  
  

Proactive, detail-oriented, and committed to high-quality testing
  
  

Ability to work independently and in cross-functional teams

title: SAP iXp Intern - Sustainability Product Marketing
description:
**We help the world run better**  

At SAP, we keep it simple: you bring your best to us, and we'll bring out the best in you. We're builders touching over 20 industries and 80% of global commerce, and we need your unique talents to help shape what's next. The work is challenging – but it matters. You'll find a place where you can be yourself, prioritize your wellbeing, and truly belong. What's in it for you? Constant learning, skill growth, great benefits, and a team that wants you to grow and succeed. **About the SAP Internship Experience Program**  

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

**Three reasons to intern at SAP**

* Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
* Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
* Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

 **What you'll do**


In this role, you’ll support the Sustainability Product Marketing team for SAP Sustainability Control Tower by conducting strategic desk research and maintaining key marketing assets. You will:

* Summarize insights from analyst reports to inform positioning and messaging around AI-based, ERP-centric sustainability solutions and the requirements of key personas (CFO and CSO).
* Investigate competitors using publicly available sources and collaborate with the Competitive Market Intelligence (CMI) team.
* Keep solution assets up-to-date, such as the Customer Value Deck and other marketing collaterals with a persona-based approach.  

  

Your work will directly contribute to shaping product strategy and ensuring SAP Sustainability Control Tower aligns with evolving market and regulatory requirements.

 **What you bring:**

* Strong analytical and research skills with attention to detail.
* Interest in sustainability, ESG reporting standards, and enterprise software.
* Ability to synthesize complex information into clear, actionable insights.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools (Excel, PowerPoint) and familiarity with online research methods.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
* Collaborative mindset and willingness to learn in a fast-paced environment.

 **Meet your team:**


You’ll join a global, purpose-driven team passionate about sustainability and innovation. We value curiosity, collaboration, and a growth mindset. This internship offers exposure to product marketing, competitive intelligence, and sustainability trends, with opportunities to learn from experienced professionals and contribute to meaningful projects.

 **Bring out your best**  

SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.
  

  

**We win with inclusion**  

SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better world.  

  

SAP is committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provides accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.  

  

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.  

  

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability, in compliance with applicable federal, state, and local legal requirements.  

  

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor. **AI Usage in the Recruitment Process**
For information on the responsible use of AI in our recruitment process, please refer to our Guidelines for Ethical Usage of AI in the Recruiting Process.
Please note that any violation of these guidelines may result in disqualification from the hiring process.
