title: Marketing Intern - Surikat
description:
*Do you enjoy creating digital experiences and want to grow your skills in a real marketing environment? We’re looking for a curious and motivated intern who wants to play an active role in improving and developing our website. This is a hands-on internship where you’ll get to work closely with our team while also taking responsibility for your own tasks.*



#### **The Internship (LIA)**



Your main focus will be our website - keeping it updated, improving structure and content, and helping us make it as clear, relevant and engaging as possible. Along the way, you’ll get insight into how a marketing department works and gain practical experience that you can apply in your future career. We’ll shape parts of the internship based on what you enjoy most, so you can grow in the areas that feel most exciting to you.

**Your main responsibilities**

* Updating and maintaining our English website
* Creating and editing website content (text, images, visuals)
* Supporting SEO improvements and on-page optimization

**Additional tasks (based on your interests)**

* Photography and basic image/video editing
* Assisting with social media and ads
* Supporting broader marketing projects within the team



#### **Who We Believe You Are:**



You’re someone who enjoys digital communication and has a natural interest in how websites are built, organized and improved. You like taking responsibility, make thoughtful decisions on your own, and you’re not afraid to try and learn new things. At the same time, you appreciate working together with a team, getting feedback and contributing to shared projects. Above all, you’re driven, eager to grow, and excited to expand your skills in a practical setting.

**What we’re looking for**

* Basic understanding of website tools or SEO
* Interest in content creation, structure and digital communication
* Strong English writing and communication skills
* A proactive, organized and curious mindset

**What we offer**

* A customized internship plan based on your interests and goals
* Practical experience with real projects and genuine responsibility
* Support and guidance from our marketing team
* A chance to build both creative and technical skills within web and digital marketing



#### **Company description**



Founded in 1996, Surikat is a Swedish IT company focused on supply chain solutions for the Transport & Logistics and Ports & Terminals sectors. Starting as a provider of supply chain solutions for DB Schenker, we have expanded over 25+ years to offer a comprehensive portfolio of transport management products used globally across six continents.


Our platforms are cloud-based SaaS (software as a service) solutions, allowing users to access information worldwide on any device, from phones and handheld devices to office desktops. We prioritise agile, flexible solutions with a clear business and operational focus. Each element of our platform is modular and scalable, designed to add value to our customers’ businesses through automating the processes for informational, physical and financial flows.

  


#### **Have Questions?**



If you have any questions about the internship, feel free to reach out to our Head of Marketing, Ebba, at ebba.martensson@surikat.se.

*The recruitment process is ongoing, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible, as the position may be filled before the application deadline.*

  

Job details

**Contact information:**

**ebba.martensson@surikat.se**

**Location:**


Göteborg

**Role:**


Marketing Internship

**Period of Internship:**


With a minimum of 12 weeks Start: Q1 2026

**Publication date:**


December 2025

title: Receptionist Scandic Växjö
description:
Ett par svängar in från E4:an ligger Scandic Växjö- mitt emot stadens största shoppingcenter och några minuters promenad från Arena Staden. Här kan våra gäster simma i inomhuspoolen, äta en god middag i Köksbaren eller ta en drink i vår lobbybar. Vi lägger stor vikt vid ett personligt, trevligt och välkomnande bemötande- mot våra gäster så klart men också mot varandra. Våra utvecklingsmöjligheter på hotellet sträcker sig längre än över avdelningsgränserna. Vi är ett stort gäng med snabba steg som är måna om att inspirera varandra så att alla ska trivas med sitt arbete på vårt spännande hotell.


**Nu söker vi en Receptionist till Scandic Växjö.**



Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Du agerar värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.



Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad är innebär rollen?**



Du som arbetar i receptionen är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Ser till att gästens önskemål uppfylls. Du har alltid ett leende på läpparna och en kreativ lösning i bakfickan. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. Din arbetsplats är vår lobby. För det är där du möter flest gäster. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning.


Arbetet i receptionen innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet. Allt arbete sker med gästnöjdhet och försäljning i fokus.


Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och det är därför viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta i skift (förmiddagar, eftermiddagar, helger & ibland även natt).


**Vem är du?**



För att passa i rollen tror vi att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster.



Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.


Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.


Allra viktigast är dock dina personliga egenskaper och din inställning. För att passa i rollen behöver du vara en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.


**Information om tjänsten**



Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på 75% .


Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!



Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------

Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

Enable "functional cookies" to watch the video


...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.
...under 2014 inledde ett samarbete med organisationen Real Stars, centrerat kring ”Fair Sex”, dvs. arbete mot människo- och sexhandel.
company_description: Nordiskt hotellföretag i världsklass som skapar enastående upplevelser för de många människorna. 16 000 medarbetar, 280 hotell i 6 länder.

title: Systems Engineer - Service Commissioning
description:
Description


Welcome to SSC – Swedish Space Corporation, the perfect workplace for those passionate about technology in general and space in particular.
With space organizations, research institutes, institutional and commercial actors as customers, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications, space consulting


services, rocket and balloon systems, flight test services, satellite propulsion systems, and much more.


SSC also has one of the world’s largest global networks of ground stations for satellite communications. We own and operate the Esrange Space Center in Kiruna,


northern Sweden, with the aim of launching satellites in the near future.

**Are you fueled by a passion for people and the ambition to create an awesome workplace?**  

**Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey with us to help Earth benefit from space?**


If you answer yes to these questions, we invite you to seize the opportunity to make a significant impact as a Systems Engineer in our team. We are looking for a dedicated personwho shares our core values of Customer passion, Care, Collaboration, Curiosity, and Courage.

  


Requirements


**YOUR ROLE**  

We offer an opportunity to be part of the Service Commissioning team, a global team that has the end-to-end responsibility of setting up SSC systems as well as execute the critical operations to our customers, providing a link from the ground to the customers satellites. As a Systems Engineer, your role is to perform multi-domain technical leadership, coordination, configuration, testing, documentation, and support. This is executed in the form of participation in projects, analyses/technical investigations as operational support, as well as support interactions with customers.
The work includes international travels to customers and other SSC facilities. As this position is critical to the operations of the SSC Services it may include out of hours working and/or being part of an on-call team with up to 1 week on-call per month.**Examples of work tasks:**

* Systems Engineer in service establishments, lead integration of new space missions into the SSC telemetry, tracking and control (TT&C) system.
* Perform critical operations and early handover phase to operations for non-critical support, as well as support incident management for routine operations.
* Interaction with customers on technical matters, document decisions, track changes and follow up on actions and overall deliverables on your projects during the integration process.
* Planning, executing and reporting testing both internally and with customer to enable a successful integration.
* Interaction with technology suppliers and vendors on technical matters.
* Providing coordination and reporting, internally and externally with customer to enable the technical implementation, on time and budget.

  

Responsibilities


**WHO YOU ARE**  

To thrive in this role, you have a drive to provide excellence in technical solutions as well as a drive to learn new things. You like technical challenges, collaboration, and teamwork in an international environment. You have some years of experience of working with systems, preferably both hardware and software, and likely excited by the growing space industry. You are able to describe your designs and ideas to customers and colleagues with the ability to communicate complex technical solutions in an easy and understandable way. As required in the Space business, you are able to write technical documentation and follow formal processes.**We also believe you have:*** Bachelor or Master degree or corresponding experience in Electrical Engineering, Telecommunication Science or Space Technology and a general interest in all three areas.
* Experience in Systems Engineering hardware/software design, integration, test or critical support.
* You are comfortable communicating in English, both written and spoken.


**It is a merit if you have:*** Comprehensive understanding of the theoretical aspects of the Space-to-Ground communications, and Software architecture.
* Experience of the Space-to-Ground Segment domain.
* Experience of Project Management, perform project planning, reporting and risk management.
* Familiarity with ground station/network equipment and protocols in satellite communication (RF modulation techniques, error coding, and standards).
* Good proficiency in Swedish.


Benefits


**WE OFFER YOU**  

* A unique chance to work with a variety of Space projects in an area that is in rapid development and innovation with the inclusion of new technologies such as Software Defined Radio and cloud technologies.
* Great possibilities to influence our way of working.
* An excellent opportunity for personal and career development.
* An exciting and dynamic workplace with employees and locations all over the world.
* Extensive customer contacts and internal coordination between different parts of the organization.
* A workplace characterized by an open atmosphere and proud employees.

 **LOCATION**


This is a permanent full-time position located in preferable Kiruna. For the right candidate there will also be a possibility working from our office in Solna, Stockholm.

 **NEXT STEP**


If this opportunity sparks your interest, don’t wait to apply! Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis, and interviews will be conducted continuously. We kindly ask you to submit your CV when applying. While you are welcome to include a brief personal note or letter, our evaluation will primarily focus on your skills and qualifications as outlined in your CV, ensuring a fair and unbiased recruitment process.


We welcome your application no later than 2026-01-04. Due to the upcoming holiday period, the recruitment process will resume in January.  

Please note however, that the job advertisement may close earlier than the stated deadline if we receive a high volume of applications. This allows us to ensure a fair and efficient recruitment process and give each application the attention it deserves.  

  

This is a security-classified position and will require a background check prior to employment.

 **WE HELP EARTH BENEFIT FROM SPACE**
Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) is a leading global provider of advanced space services, with more than 50 years of experience. We help space organizations, research institutes, commercial and institutional actors from all over the world to get access to space.


With local presence on all continents and about 700 committed employees, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications and satellite control services, spacecraft operations, rocket and balloon systems, launch services and flight test services, as well as engineering, operations and consultancy services for space missions.


 We help Earth benefit from Space. Learn more at sscspace.com

title: Receptionist, Scandic Visby
description:
Om hotellet
  
  

Scandic Visby är beläget med bästa utgångspunkt för att upptäcka medeltidsstaden eller ta sig vidare med bil ut på landsbygden. Ett härligt hotell med en känsla av resort, där rummen är uppdelade i olika byggnader. Vår restaurang är öppet året runt där vi serverar frukost på morgonen och middag på kvällen, med menyer som anpassas efter säsong. Under sommaren öppnar vi vår härliga uteservering med utomhuspool och för den som vill bada året runt, erbjuder vi den varma bubbelpoolen under bar himmel.
  
  

Vi som jobbar här fokuserar på ett personligt, trevligt och välkomnande bemötande mot våra gäster så klart, men också mot varandra. Vi har alltid fokus på vårt gemensamma arbete och sluter upp tillsammans där det behövs. Genom att vara ett team som jobbar med mycket inspiration och glädje skapar vi fantastiska hotellupplevelser för våra gäster

Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Ser till att gästens önskemål uppfylls. Du har alltid ett leende på läpparna och en kreativ lösning i bakfickan. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet. Allt arbete sker med gästnöjdhet och försäljning i fokus.

Vem är du?
  
  

För att passa i rollen tror vi att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster.
  
  

Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.
  
  

Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande. Vi ser gärna att du fyllt 20 år på grund av regelverket av vårt serveringstillstånd.
  
  

Allra viktigast är dock dina personliga egenskaper och din inställning. För att passa i rollen behöver du vara en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet. Meriterande är om du har någon form av utbildning inom Hotell.
  
  

Information om tjänsten
  
  

Tjänsten är ett vikariat på deltid ca. 40% från januari till mars, med stor möjlighet till säsongsarbete på 70-80% fram till augusti.
  
  

Hotellet är öppet dygnet runt alla dagar i veckan. Du arbetar i shift morgon och kvälls pass, vardagar och helger. Nattjänst kan förekomma.
  
  

Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.
  
  

Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic Visby!
  
  

Vi som jobbar här fokuserar på ett personligt, trevligt och välkomnande bemötande mot våra gäster så klart, men också mot varandra. Vi har alltid fokus på vårt gemensamma arbete och sluter upp tillsammans där det behövs. Genom att vara ett team som jobbar med mycket inspiration och glädje skapar vi fantastiska hotellupplevelser för våra gäster.

Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic Visby.

title: School Economist
description:
Östersund


School Economist


You need to sign in to apply. You can sign in here.
Vacancy details


School Östersund
  

Position School Economist
  

Position starts 2 February 2026
  

Publish date 4 December 2025 17:00
  

Closes at 17 December 2025 16:59
  

Contract type Substitute
  

Working hours Full time
  

Working language Swedish and English
  

Contact


Name Recruitment
  

Phone 063-77 80 71
  

Email recruitment.ostersund@engelska.se
  

About this vacancy


**Skolekonom & HR Administratör**


Vi söker nu en Skolekonom & HR Administratör till IES Östersund! Tjänsten är ett vikariat på ett år med start efter årsskiftet. Du som söker rollen har en eftergymnasial utbildning i ekonomi eller har förvärvat motsvarande kompetens i redovisning.


Du kommer att arbeta självständigt och proaktivt med uppföljning och rapportering som rör skolans ekonomi. Tillsammans med kollegorna inom administration söker ni kontinuerligt nya vägar att förbättra flöden, arbetssätt och processer.


Om rollen


Skolekonomens roll delegeras av rektor för att säkerställa att skolans ekonomiska och budgetmässiga arbete fungerar effektivt på både lång och kort sikt. Skolekonomen arbetar nära rektor, biträdande rektorer, och administrationen med eleven i fokus.


Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter innehåller bland annat

* sammanställa kontrakt till personal
* bistå rektor i både det löpande budgetarbetet
* månadsvisa avstämningar av skolpeng och kontakt med kommuner, samt årlig granskning
* månadsrapportering samt kostnadsuppföljning med kommentarer
* löpande bokföring i Hogia (ex. fakturera, kreditera, bokföra utlägg, avstämma handkassa samt företagskort)
* analyser av avvikelser
* kontrollera och kontera leverantörsfakturor i Rillion
* hantera migration ansökningar
* hantera, kontrollera, godkänn och följa upp kundfakturor i Hogia Cloud
* Payroll (Medvind/Visma)- hantera övertid, ledigheter, sjukdom osv.
* inrapportering SCB-statistik, samt övriga efterfrågningar kring statistisk som kräver inrapportering
* delta i månadsmöten online för skolekonomer inom IES, månadsmöten online HR


Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik i denna roll:


Som person är du driven, nyfiken och strukturerad.


Du kommunicerar väl, både på svenska och engelska, har hög social förmåga och trivs med många kontaktytor. Du känner dig bekväm med Excel samt Google worksheets.


Särskilt meriterande är erfarenhet från skolvärlden.


Skicka in er ansökan med ert CV och personliga brev till recruitment.ostersund@engelska.se. Rekrytering sker löpande.


About IES


*Internationella Engelska Skolan (IES) is a leading independent school group with academic results far above average and a diverse and energetic staff. Teaching is in both Swedish and English, and the hallways are bilingual. The language of meetings and communication amongst the staff is English.* *IES is one of Sweden's largest school groups at compulsory school level with 48 schools and around 32,000 students across the country. IES has grown steadily and maintained quality since 1993.*  

N.B. Prior to any offer of employment at IES, a criminal background check is required for all applicants. In Sweden, this is an extract from belastningsregistret from Polismyndigheten and from abroad, this is a record extract from an equivalent police governing body.

title: Solution Consultant – Pagero
description:
Are you passionate about shaping strategic deals and influencing customer success at the earliest stages? If you thrive on consultative engagement, love solving complex challenges, and want to make an impact in a global team driving growth across dynamic markets - this opportunity is for you.


We are currently seeking a Solution Consultant to join our office in Gothenburg, Sweden. This role will be part of our global Solutions team within the commercial organization. The Solutions team partners closely with sales and channel teams to drive opportunity development from early engagement through to successful close. The position focuses on delivering consultative pre-sales expertise, aligning customer needs with our solutions, and ensuring strategic deals are positioned for success.


Pagero has recently joined Thomson Reuters. Together, we are building the world’s largest, open business network. With our cloud-based network, customers can reach any business, anywhere in the world – no matter how many borders their operations may cross. We take care of the technical and regulatory requirements across the entire order-to-cash, purchase-to-pay and freight processes, to give customers data accuracy and security, transparency, and real-time visibility. All this through a single connection.


**About the Role**

In this opportunity as a Solution Consultant, you will:


* Partner with sales and channel teams to provide expert presales support across TR ONESOURCE Pagero services and related SaaS solutions
* Conduct customer discovery sessions and deep dives to uncover needs and align solutions effectively
* Deliver compelling product presentations and live demonstrations showcasing the ONESOURCE Pagero platform.
* Manage demo environments, including accounts, data, and scripts, ensuring readiness for customer engagements
* Respond to RFx requests and commercial team inquiries with accurate, timely, and value-driven information
* Maintain knowledge resources in our knowledge database tool and stay current on global regulatory mandates, ViDA updates, and new product features
* Collaborate with solution leadership to share product ideas and improve processes that enhance team efficiency and consistency

**About You**

You’re a fit for the role of a Solution Consultant if you have the following required qualifications:


* 1 – 3+ years in presales, solution consulting, technical consulting, or professional services within SaaS B2B/P2P/O2C environments
* Degree-level education and fluency in English (spoken, written, and reading)
* Strong understanding of Purchase-to-Pay (P2P) and Order-to-Cash (O2C) processes
* Proven client-facing experience with excellent communication and presentation skills
* Solid knowledge of connectivity and e-invoicing data formats, including regional mandates and ViDA compliance.
* Ability to articulate complex concepts clearly and adapt messaging for different audiences
* Collaborative mindset with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
* Successfully pass an extended background check

Additional preferred qualifications include:


* Advanced expertise in ONESOURCE Pagero or similar EU e-invoice service providers
* Familiarity with ERP systems, data import/export, and AR/AP processes
* Additional language expertise is a plus

The deadline for applications is **Monday 15th December 2025 at 1700 GMT**

#LI-KA1


**What’s in it For You?**

* **Hybrid Work Model:** We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected.
* **Flexibility & Work-Life Balance:** Flex My Way is a set of supportive workplace policies designed to help manage personal and professional responsibilities, whether caring for family, giving back to the community, or finding time to refresh and reset. This builds upon our flexible work arrangements, including work from anywhere for up to 8 weeks per year, empowering employees to achieve a better work-life balance.
* **Career Development and Growth:** By fostering a culture of continuous learning and skill development, we prepare our talent to tackle tomorrow’s challenges and deliver real-world solutions. Our Grow My Way programming and skills-first approach ensures you have the tools and knowledge to grow, lead, and thrive in an AI-enabled future.
* **Industry Competitive Benefits:** We offer comprehensive benefit plans to include flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days off, access to the Headspace app, retirement savings, tuition reimbursement, employee incentive programs, and resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized, award-winning reputation for inclusion and belonging, flexibility, work-life balance, and more. We live by our values: Obsess over our Customers, Compete to Win, Challenge (Y)our Thinking, Act Fast / Learn Fast, and Stronger Together.
* **Social Impact:** Make an impact in your community with our Social Impact Institute. We offer employees two paid volunteer days off annually and opportunities to get involved with pro-bono consulting projects and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives.
* **Making a Real-World Impact:** We are one of the few companies globally that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.


**About Us**

Thomson Reuters informs the way forward by bringing together the trusted content and technology that people and organizations need to make the right decisions. We serve professionals across legal, tax, accounting, compliance, government, and media. Our products combine highly specialized software and insights to empower professionals with the data, intelligence, and solutions needed to make informed decisions, and to help institutions in their pursuit of justice, truth, and transparency. Reuters, part of Thomson Reuters, is a world leading provider of trusted journalism and news.


We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness, and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.


As a global business, we rely on the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of all employees to deliver on our business goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer providing a drug-free workplace.


We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law. More information on requesting an accommodation here .

title: Senior Data Analyst - Pagero
description:
We are seeking a Data Analyst with a passion for uncovering insights, shaping data stories, and enabling data-driven decisions. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality analytics solutions, create impactful dashboards, and translate business needs into actionable metrics. Your work will empower stakeholders across the organization with self-serve analytics, robust datasets, and clear visualizations.


Pagero has recently joined Thomson Reuters. Together, we are building the world’s largest, open business network. All this through a single connection.


**About the role**

* Collaborating with business and technical stakeholders to understand requirements and define analytics outcomes.
* Analyzing, cleaning, and transforming raw data into actionable insights and clear visualizations.
* Building and maintaining dashboards and reports to enable efficient, exploratory analysis.
* Creating and maintaining accurate, consumable datasets to support analytics needs.
* Tracking and reporting key metrics to drive business outcomes.
* Advocating for data quality, governance, and scalable data management practices across the organization.
* Running workshops and presenting findings to senior business and IT stakeholders.
* Working closely with data engineers to enhance data pipelines and the data warehouse.
* Staying up to date with new technologies and analytics methodologies.

**About you**

* Demonstrable experience transforming raw data into impactful business insights.
* Advanced proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
* Hands-on experience with analytics and BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Superset).
* Experience building and maintaining dashboards and data visualizations.
* Programming experience with Python and/or Scala is a plus.
* Strong business acumen and ability to communicate technical findings to non-technical stakeholders.
* Experience working with senior business and IT stakeholders.
* Fast learner, self-starter, and intellectually curious.
* Commitment to data quality and continuous improvement.
* Fluent in English.
* Nice to have: Experience with machine learning, open-source contributions, or relevant business domains.
* Successfully pass an extended background check.

description:

* Implement automated tests as part of delivery.
* Participate in Agile/Scrum ceremonies and contribute to sprint planning, reviews, and retrospectives.

* Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases.
* Good knowledge of Docker, Kubernetes, or other containerization tools.

title: Regulatory Associate - Pagero
description:
**Regulatory Associate - Pagero**

Are you ready to tackle the complexities of global regulatory compliance and drive innovation in e-invoicing and tax technology? As a member of the Regulatory Affairs team, you can be a part of our journey as the global leader in invoicing compliance.


Pagero has recently joined Thomson Reuters. Together, we are building the world’s largest, open business network. With our cloud-based network, customers can reach any business, anywhere in the world – no matter how many borders their operations may cross. We take care of the technical and regulatory requirements across the entire order-to-cash, purchase-to-pay and freight processes, to give customers data accuracy and security, transparency, and real-time visibility. All this through a single connection.


Global regulatory compliance with e-invoicing and CTC (continuous transaction control) mandates presents a formidable and ongoing challenge for multinationals. The landscape of regulations governing indirect tax and the application of tax technologies is expanding but often involves a lack of uniformity among different regulatory bodies. This complexity, fragmentation, and evolving nature of compliance requirements necessitates a dedicated and knowledgeable team.  



  

We are seeking an Associate to join Pagero – Part of Thomson Reuters’ Regulatory Affairs (RA) team. The RA team has been instrumental in Pagero’s successful global expansion, establishing our position as the global leader in e-invoicing and CTC compliance. This role offers a unique opportunity to contribute to a dynamic and critical area of our business, ensuring that we continue to lead and innovate in this essential field.  

  



**About the Role**  

In this opportunity as Regulatory Associate, you will:


* Analyze and investigate requirements and legislation in markets that Pagero plans to enter
* Maintain and monitor up-to-date knowledge of regulatory requirements in markets that Pagero currently supports
* Create compliance related content, including blogs and updates, for internal and external readers
* Collaborate with stakeholders to launch new markets including integration, marketing, delivery, and more departments
* Present Pagero’s compliance solutions and relevant business cases to customers, curated for both technical and c-level audiences
* Address queries from internal and external stakeholders, ranging from simple to complex

**About You**  

You’re a fit for the role of Regulatory Associate if you have the following required qualifications:


* At least 1-3 years of experience in e-invoicing/CTC, tax technology and/or indirect tax.Applicants with legal or compliance experience in digital, privacy and/or security areas, and the readiness to apply that knowledge to digital settings, as well as to learn new skills, will be considered.
* Relevant academic degree: ex. Business, Law, Economics, or similar with relevant work experience
* Fluent in both spoken and written English
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong ability to collaborate effectively within a team environment and document information clearly.
* Proficient with MS Office, comfortable with agentic AI and other planning and visualization tools
* Successfully pass an extended background check (criminal and credit).

Additional preferred qualifications include:


* Knowledge of other languages is highly merited, including French, German, Arabic, Mandarin and more (preferred, but not required)
* Experience in ERP, B2B and data integration including solutions such as managed services (preferred, but not required)

We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness, and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.


As a global business, we rely on the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of all employees to deliver on our business goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer providing a drug-free workplace.


We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law. More information on requesting an accommodation here .


Learn more on how to protect yourself from fraudulent job postings here .


More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.
company_description: We inform the way forward by delivering trusted content and technology that professionals and institutions need to make the right decisions.

title: Lead System Architect
description:
**Here are the job details-** 




  





**Summary of Position-** 




 The Lead Systems Architect (LSA) is the senior technical authority responsible for designing, integrating, and scaling Pega Customer Decision Hub (CDH) solutions within a client’s enterprise ecosystem. The LSA specializes in backend system integrations; ensuring real-time, reliable, secure, and high-volume data exchange between CDH and customer platforms such as CRM, MDM, billing, data lakes, marketing clouds, event hubs, and channel systems.
 



  





**Role :** 
 Lead Pega Systems Architect
 



**Location:** 
 Frankfurt Germany (Remote) onsite once in a month
 



**Type:** 
 Contract/Permanent
 



**Language Requirement :** 
 C1/C2 German and English speaker
 



  





**Key Responsibilities-** 




**Enterprise Architecture & Integration Design** 



* Architect end-to-end integration patterns between Pega CDH and enterprise systems using REST/JSON, SOAP, Kafka, MQ, SFTP, and ETL pipelines
* Define high-level and detailed architecture blueprints, including data flow diagrams, sequence diagrams, integration specifications, and deployment architectures
* Ensure integrations support real-time decisioning, high throughput, low latency, and high availability across all customer touchpoints
* Select and enforce standards for authentication, authorization, encryption, error handling, retries, logging, and API versioning



**Technical Leadership & Delivery Oversight** 



* Serve as the technical lead for integration workstreams across all environments (Dev → Prod)
* Review and approve all system integration designs, mappings, and interface specifications
* Guide developers and architects in building scalable and reusable components
* Ensure delivered integrations align with enterprise security, compliance, and architectural governance



**CDH Enablement & Ecosystem Orchestration** 



* Design data sourcing strategies for interaction history, customer profile feeds, decisioning data, and AI model inputs
* Collaborate with Decisioning Architects and Data Architects to ensure integrations enable real-time eligibility, suitability, arbitration, and propensity scoring
* Optimize container behavior for inbound channels including web, mobile, contact center, ATM/kiosk, and IVR



**Client Engagement & Advisory** 



* Lead workshops with IT, enterprise architects, and application owners to define integration requirements
* Present architectural recommendations, integration patterns, and trade-offs to executive and technical stakeholders
* Troubleshoot complex integration issues, identify root causes, and drive long-term resolutions



**Quality, Performance & Governance** 



* Define non-functional requirements (NFRs) including performance benchmarks, throughput thresholds, and resiliency SLAs
* Oversee performance testing, failover validation, environment readiness, and capacity planning
* Ensure solutions adhere to SDLC best practices and are built for maintainability and scale



  





  





**Required Experience & Skills-** 



* 8+ years of architecture experience in enterprise systems, customer platforms, or integration engineering
* 5+ years in Pega Platform or Pega CDH delivery, preferably in an LSA or senior integration role
* Deep expertise in RESTful service design, event-based architectures, and API/microservices frameworks
* Strong understanding of relational/NoSQL databases, real-time streaming (Kafka, Kinesis), and middleware
* Proficiency with security standards, high-availability patterns, and cloud-native architectures
* Ability to translate business requirements into robust, scalable integration solutions
* Excellent communication skills for technical and executive audiences



  





  





**Thanks & Regards**

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
*Vi utmanar de traditionella konsultbolagen och vi kan med stolthet säga att Castra är konsultbranschens mest utvecklande arbetsplats där allt är möjligt. Känns det här som företaget för dig så läs gärna vidare.*
**Rollen**
 I rollen som DevOps Engineer kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att optimera och automatisera våra kunders utvecklings- och driftsprocesser.
   

  

**I rollen kommer du:**
* Designa, implementera och underhålla CI/CD-pipelines.
* Automatisera driftsättningar och infrastrukturer med hjälp av verktyg som Ansible, Terraform, eller liknande.
* Säkerställa systemens säkerhet, prestanda och tillgänglighet.
* Samarbeta med utvecklingsteam för att identifiera och lösa problem snabbt och effektivt.
* Implementera och övervaka loggning och övervakningssystem för att säkerställa proaktiv drift.


**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Erfarenhet av DevOps-metoder och verktyg.
* Erfarenhet av Linux
* Stark kompetens i molntjänster som AWS, Azure, eller Google Cloud.
* Erfarenhet av containerteknologier som Docker och Kubernetes.
* Kunskap i skript- och programmeringsspråk som Python, Bash, eller liknande.
* Förståelse för versioneringssystem som Git.
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och i team, med stark problemlösningsförmåga.


**Meriterande:**
* Certifieringar inom molntjänster (AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, Azure DevOps Engineer, etc.).
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila miljöer.


**Bara det bästa åt de bästa – vår personalfilosofi**
 Castra är en konsultgrupp inom IT och Management. Eller ja, en elite squad kan man säga. Vi samlar de vassaste och mest erfarna konsulterna, helt enkelt för att det är hos oss de får ut max i både kapacitet och livskvalitet. Vi är verksamma inom Systemutveckling, IT-infrastruktur, IT-styrning & Ledarskap samt IT-säkerhet.
   

  

 Vi är Sveriges bästa arbetsplats, på riktigt! Det låter lite skrytsamt, men det är faktiskt inte vi som sagt det. Castra har sedan 2017 blivit certifierad av
 **Great Place to Work** 
 och har de senaste två åren blivit utnämnda till
 **Sveriges Bästa Arbetsplats** 
 för stora bolag. Som grädde på moset är vi även ett Gasell- och Karriärföretag. Vi blev även 2025 utnämnda till
 **Europas Bästa Arbetsplats.**
 På Castra tror vi på frihet, utveckling och gemenskap. Du som konsult styr själv vilka uppdrag du tar, när du jobbar, om du vill levla upp någon kompetens och hur och mycket lön och semester du tar ut. Att du får bygga din egen logga är bara en bonus! Trodde du det var allt? Då trodde du fel. Stöd av bra chefer, aktiviteter, kompetent och snabbfotad säljstyrka, möjlighet till delägarskap, stora möjligheter att påverka bolagets framtid och härliga kollegor – listan på vad som gör Castra till en fantastisk arbetsplats kan göras lååång. Möjligheterna bra nära oändliga. Win för alla parter, säger vi.
   

  

*Castra har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro, Jönköping och Sundsvall.*
 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss på castra.se/konsulterbjudande/
   

  

**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?**
**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?** 
 Sök direkt via länken eller kontakta Charlotta.Ljung@@castra.se Tfn: 072-871 63 12

title: Founding Platform Engineer
description:
**About Lavoit** 





 We are Lavoit.
 





 We are engineering the intelligence layer that optimizes hydrogen production through AI and physics-based modeling.
 





 Hydrogen is the base layer for the future energy system, but the industry is stuck in a 20th-century hardware mindset.
 





 We are here to build the world's most important energy company. The pace is blistering. The pressure is maximum. If you want a comfortable 9-to-5, do not apply. We aren't here for incremental gains. If you want to build the ship while shipping and look back in 10 years knowing you changed the world, welcome home.
 




  





**Mission** 





 Be the bridge between physical assets and digital intelligence. You will design the edge infrastructure that connects real machines to our cloud systems and you will make it work under real world conditions.
 




  





**What you will do** 



* Architect and maintain the IoT and edge compute layer using MQTT, Modbus and PLC communication
* Implement real time data ingestion from sensors and industrial controllers
* Deploy systems at customer sites and debug under real operational pressure
* Ensure reliable connectivity between edge and cloud
* Bring field learnings directly into product and architecture decisions
* Act as the technical face of Lavoit in industrial environments





 ﻿
 





**Who you are** 



* Experienced in industrial automation, PLCs, IoT or edge computing
* You operate with execution first thinking and high speed
* You work closely with a high performing team and value tight alignment in the field and in development
* You communicate clearly and treat collaboration as essential for safety and reliability
* You are self reflective and learn from every deployment and failure
* You are obsessed with reliability, robustness and real world performance
* You love to win whether in a server room or a harsh industrial environment
* You take ownership end to end and never hide behind roles
* You thrive in pressure, complexity and hands on engineering

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**Senior Data Engineer- Avida Finans** 




  





**About Avida:** 




 At Avida, we specialize in consumer and SME financing, delivering exceptional customer experiences both digitally and personally. We are currently on an exciting transformation journey. As of January 1, 2025, we proudly completed the acquisition of Santander Consumer Bank's credit card operations in Sweden and Norway, as well as their retail financing business with Elkjøp (Norway) and Elgiganten (Sweden). This milestone brought
 **450,000 new private customers** 
 .
 



 With our headquarters in
 **Stockholm** 
 and offices in
 **Oslo, Helsinki, and Stavanger** 
 , Avida now has a team of approximately 170 employees. We are regulated by the Swedish Financial Supervisory Authority (Finansinspektionen) and are committed to shaping the future of finance.
 



  





  





**We’re Hiring: Senior Data Engineer** 




  





 We’re seeking an experienced Data Engineer with at least 5 years professional experience to join our dynamic and collaborative team at Avida. This role is pivotal in driving
 **data innovation** 
 and ensuring that our data infrastructure is scalable, efficient, and future-proof. You’ll have the opportunity to contribute to exciting business analytics and reporting initiatives while collaborating across departments.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* Develop and maintain scalable Data pipelines
 
 using tools like DBT,
 
 Matillion and SQL.
* Collaborate with data infrastructure and Data teams to design optimal solutions for data ingestion and reporting.
* Seamlessly ingest data into Snowflake to enable advanced analytics and reporting.
* Serve as a technical expert, supporting business users in leveraging data effectively.
* Ensure data integrity, security, and governance across systems and workflows.
* Document and communicate technical solutions to ensure clarity across the organization.



  





**What We’re Looking For:** 



* Strong SQL skills and a solid understanding of cloud-based data platforms.
* Knowledge of best practices in data warehousing and data modeling
* Hands on experience working with Data Vault is a must
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work cross-functionally.
* Ability to work independently or as part of a team to deliver high-quality results.



  





**Preferred Skills:** 



* Experience with Python and ETL tools like DBT and Matillion
* Hands-on experience with Snowflake.
* Experience working with Tableau or similar visualization software to bring data insights to life.



  





**Why Avida?** 




 At Avida, you’ll be part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and personal growth. We’re on a mission to transform the financial landscape and are looking for talented individuals to help us get there. With a supportive work culture and exciting challenges, this is your chance to make a real impact.
 



  





**Application Process:** 




 This recruitment is managed by
 **UNQ Recruitment** 
 , and we kindly ask recruitment and consulting firms not to contact us directly. All applications and initial interviews will be conducted by them.
 



 If you have any questions about the role, please contact
 **Nina Sejdini** 
 via email at
 **nina@unqgroup.se.**

title: Product Data Analyst
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
**The Role**
 As a
 **Product Data Analyst** 
 you will be instrumental in driving product decisions through data at Legora. You will analyse user behaviour, measure product performance, and uncover insights that shape our product roadmap. Whilst this is a full-stack data role where you'll build and maintain the analytical infrastructure needed to support your work, the primary focus is on delivering actionable insights that help us build better products for lawyers.
   

  

 This is a key role that sits at the intersection of product, analytics, and engineering — translating complex data into clear recommendations that drive product strategy. Your work will directly influence how we prioritise features, optimise user experience, and scale our platform.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Analyse product usage patterns, user behaviour, and feature adoption to identify opportunities for improvement and growth.
* Partner closely with Product Managers and designers to define success metrics, design experiments, and measure impact of product initiatives.
* Build and maintain dashboards and automated reporting systems that enable self-service analytics across the product organisation.
* Conduct deep-dive analyses to answer critical product questions and inform strategic decisions.
* Design, build, and maintain data pipelines and data models to support product analytics and reporting needs.


**Who You Are**
* Solid experience in a product analytics, data analyst, or analytics engineering role, ideally in a product-led or SaaS environment.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate ambiguous questions into structured analyses and clear recommendations.
* Proficient in SQL and experienced with modern BI tools; familiarity with Python, dbt, and cloud data warehouses like Snowflake is a plus.
* Understanding of data modelling, ELT best practices, and building analytical systems that are reliable and scalable.
* Experience designing and analysing A/B tests and other product experiments.
* A collaborative, curious mindset with excellent communication skills and the ability to influence product decisions through data storytelling.
* But most importantly, you are someone who
+ “Gets stuff done” and understands building a $10bn company isn’t always glamorous and takes hard work and long hours
+ Strives in a fast-paced environment where the answers aren’t always clear and processes are few


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Linux Engineer
description:
Vill du arbeta med drift och utveckling av komplexa IT-lösningar i en samhällsviktig verksamhet? Vi söker nu en Linux Engineer till ett uppdrag inom Technology Operations, en central del av organisationens tekniska driftsfunktion.
   

  

 Som Linux Engineer kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i att säkerställa en stabil, säker och framtidssäker driftmiljö. Du blir en viktig del i ett team som ansvarar för att både kravställa och leverera IT-tjänster med hög tillgänglighet och kvalitet – oavsett om de levereras internt eller via externa parter.
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 I rollen som Linux Engineer arbetar du brett med drift, utveckling och förbättring av IT-lösningar. Du får möjlighet att påverka den tekniska plattformen och bidra till att verksamheten fortsätter leverera pålitliga och säkra tjänster.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden inkluderar:**
* Utveckla, underhålla och implementera IT-lösningar, integrationer och konfigureringar i linje med verksamhetens mål
* Ansvara för den dagliga driften av infrastrukturen och säkerställa att SLA-krav uppfylls
* Hantera incidenter, beställningar och förändringar
* Delta i strategisk planering, kravhantering och uppföljning av IT-lösningar
* Bidra till teknisk dokumentation och kontinuerliga förbättringar


**Din profil:**
 För att lyckas i rollen söker vi dig som trivs i en dynamisk miljö där du får kombinera drift, utveckling och problemlösning. Du har en stark teknisk förståelse, arbetar strukturerat och är van vid att ta ansvar för både kvalitet och säkerhet i dina leveranser.
   

  

**Vi ser gärna att du har:**
* Mycket goda kunskaper inom Linux system administration
* Erfarenhet av skriptspråk, exempelvis Bash
* Erfarenhet av automationsverktyg och Infrastructure as Code, exempelvis Ansible
* God förståelse för säkerhetsarbete kopplat till Linuxplattformar (t.ex. härdning)
* Förståelse för DevOps, Cloud Native och Cloud-lösningar
* Erfarenhet av arbete med servermiljöer med höga krav på tillgänglighet och kontinuitet
* Erfarenhet av arbete enligt ITIL-processer
* Relevant akademisk examen eller motsvarande erfarenhet inom området


**Personliga egenskaper:**
 Vi söker dig som är analytisk, lösningsorienterad och har en god förmåga att samarbeta med andra. Du kommunicerar tydligt och har lätt för att skapa goda relationer, både internt och externt.
   

  

 Du motiveras av att bidra till en stabil och säker IT-miljö och vill vara en del av en verksamhet där ditt arbete verkligen gör skillnad.
   

  

**Varför den här rollen?**
 Här erbjuds du möjlighet att arbeta långsiktigt och tekniskt djupt i en strategiskt viktig plattform. Du blir en central del av ett högkompetent team som värdesätter kvalitet, innovation och samarbete – och där din kompetens verkligen gör skillnad.
   

  

 Tjänsten gäller en långsiktig anställning hos kunden.
   

  

 Är du redo för nästa utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan så återkommer vi med mer information om nästa steg.

title: Data Architect
description:
**Att jobba som data architect**
 Som data architect kommer du tillhöra vårt Data & Analytics team som är organiserat inom Finance för att stötta hela Skandias verksamhet. Teamet består av arkitekter, systemutvecklare och verksamhetsutvecklare som alla sitter på vårt huvudkontor i Stockholm. Vi är med och bidrar till Skandias digitaliseringsresa genom att etablera ett nytt informationsförsörjningssystem och förbättrade analyticsförmågor. Vi säkerställer att rätt data finns tillgänglig på ett effektivt och säkert sätt.
   

  

 Du kommer ha det övergripande ansvaret för att designa dataarkitekturen för våra dataflöden, modeller, lagringsmönster och integrationer. Likväl säkerställer du att vi följer våra regelverk (t.ex. GDPR) och långsiktiga värde mot affären. Rollen innebär nära dialog med lösningsarkitekter inom området, utvecklingsteam på IT sidan samt andra verksamhets­utvecklare inom Skandias verksamhet. Du kommunicerar regelbundet med ledningsgrupper och seniora chefer inom Skandia, vilket gör din roll både affärsnära och strategisk. Hos Skandia får du vara med på en spännande förändringsresa och jobba i en organisation som jobbar agilt och som värdesätter hållbara lösningar.
   

  

 Vi arbetar hybrid, vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till chefen för Data & Analytics.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Som person är du driven, tålmodig och gillar att leda i förändring. Du kan bygga starka relationer med andra intressenter både internt och externt genom att kunna kommunicera enkelt med både IT- och affärssidan.
   

  

 För att lyckas ser vi att du har mångårig erfarenhet som data architect eller liknande roller. Du har kunskap om dataarkitekturprinciper och förmåga att utforma en effektiv och skalbar datastruktur. Datamodelleringsprinciper inklusive Data Vault är något som du har kännedom om. Du kan ETL-processer och verktyg för att integrera och transformera data från olika källor. Erfarenhet av molnbaserade plattformar och data-hanterings¬ramverk som Azure, Snowflake, Hadoop eller motsvarande gör att du kan navigera i våran tekniska miljö. Slutligen är du bekant och kan arbetat med agila ramverk och metoder. Ett grundkrav i rollen är att du kan flytande svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Meriterande är om du har en relevant högskoleutbildning eller har jobbat inom bank-, finans- eller försäkringsområdet.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Hellen Malmberg på hellen.malmberg@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocess, vänligen ta kontakt med Harald Brehmer Talent Acquisition Partner på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om Finance**
 Inom Finance arbetar vi
 *framåt tillsammans* 
 för att vara en affärsnära partner och skapa långsiktigt värde för Skandia. Totalt sett består vi av fem olika avdelningar med ungefär 120 medarbetare som alla sitter i Stockholm på Lindhagensgatan 86.
   

  

 Våra avdelningar inom Finance är: Finance Transformation & Infomation , Accounting & Reporting, Aktuarie & Modellering, Inköp & Support samt Group Planning & Control.
   

  

 Tillsammans strävar vi efter att skapa ett effektivt och värdeskapande Finance. Vi arbetar proaktivt för att säkerställa effektiva kärnprocesser genom att följa externa och interna krav. Vårt huvuduppdrag är att stödja koncernledningen med analyser och strategiska beslutsunderlag samt övriga verksamhetsområden inom koncernen. Vi stödjer även våra funktioner med finansiell analys och rapportering. Vårt gemensamma arbete ska hålla hög kvalitet och skapa värde för Skandia. Tillsammans optimerar vi financeområdet genom nya teknologier, arbetssätt och kompetenser. Detta åstadkommer vi genom gott ledarskap, samarbete och engagemang.

title: Presales Lead Cybersecurity
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

**The role**
 You will be part of Capgemini's
 **Cloud & Infrastructure Services (CIS)** 
 unit, focusing on project and consulting services in the Nordics. Our goal is to offer customers comprehensive cloud solutions with industry-specific expertise, advanced cloud technology, and global resources. We offer a variety of services to our customers, from strategic advice to project implementation.
   

  

 This Role sits at the heart of the customer business problem in creating and proposing the best of Capgemini as a solution that is a match for the client requirement. You engage with the customer, either proactively or via request, to draw out the business challenges that they have and align the Capgemini solution portfolio to it. Communicating the solution to the client, you demonstrate the value that Capgemini adds and how we are differentiated to meet and exceed their business needs.
   

  

 The role needs a techno-functional visionary leader with strategic thinking and a strong knowledge of Cloud and Infrastructure solutions with a particular focus on Cyber Security, PAM and IAM.
   

  

 Responsibilities:
   

  

* Actively develop and drive strategic and tactical opportunities within the Nordics
* Collaborating with Market and Portfolio sales teams to identify potential customers and develop a deep understanding of their technical and business requirements
* Engage with the client in a compelling and collaborative way to establish trust and understand their business and how Capgemini can help them
* Develop compelling cost effective/compelling solutions using the best of Capgemini to exceed client expectations
* Provide technical and sector guidance and support throughout the sales process, including responding to inquiries, conducting assessments, and developing proposals
* Participate in industry events and conferences to share your knowledge and expertise and network with customers and partners showing thought leadership
* Act as a Nordic SPOC for the Cyber GTM organization, leveraging additional resource capacity from the global Cyber organization
* When required, operate as a Solution Lead or Solution Architect to provide essential deal capacity
* Work across our partner organisations to bring the best of their products/services together with Capgemini services (Microsoft, Z Scaler). Strong knowledge and experience of industry standard Cyber and Access Management tooling platforms is essential, including EntraID and AD


**Your profile**
* Demonstrable experience of navigating a large matrixed Service Provider type organizations including Run (Managed Services) and Projects and Consulting structures
* Strong transformation/change and solutions expertise
* Full working proficiency in English
* Demonstrated ability to develop and deliver compelling technical demonstrations and presentations
* Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to understand and address complex technical challenges


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* A challenging career in a vibrant environment with access to extensive training, a global network of experts and an innovative culture that promotes learning, growth, and shared success
* Opportunities to work on real-world problems and help transform leading organizations
* A company culture driven by core values: Honesty, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, Modesty, Fun, and Boldness
* A strong commitment to inclusion, diversity, and supporting the whole person


*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be conducted through inspection of your ID card, and background checks may be carried out as required.*
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: Executive Assistant / Corporate Administrator
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few roles based in offices. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing. We are hiring
 **Executive Assistants and Corporate Administrators** 
 to join our Corporate Operations team. We ensure that the business runs smoothly and that travel, expenses and events are efficiently and correctly managed.
   

  

 We look for positive team players who are self-driven and results oriented, with excellent attention to detail. The best candidates show that they are forward planners, reliable and determined, and keen to assume responsibility for projects, processes and policy. We are a unique global business, so we are not looking for candidates with extensive experience so much as excellent organisers and communicators who are keen to develop skills and strive for continuous improvement.
   

  

 This team plays a crucial role in the overall operation of the business. They run significant business operations and processes, supporting the respective department leads but also taking central responsibility for logistics, expenses, travel and scheduling. They are the secret to our success! We look for confident and effective people who have good judgment and the self-assurance to hold firm on a point of policy regardless of the seniority of people on the other side of a discussion. If you like to take responsibility and you like to ensure that things are done properly and efficiently then you will enjoy the role tremendously.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This is a global operation, we have open roles in teams in all time zones.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Support operations for one or more departments in the company
* Coordinate monthly reports and schedule meetings and interviews
* Organise and run international company events including logistics
* Manage quarterly and annual executive meetings
* Collaborate across teams on activities and initiatives
* Manage suppliers and stakeholders


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Excellent academic results at school and university
* A degree in a business or technical subject
* Excellent communication skills
* Responsibility, integrity and accountability
* Self-awareness and thoughtfulness
* Ability to travel up to four times a year for company events of up to two weeks duration
* Ability to learn new technology and software quickly


**Additional Skills We Value**
* Experience in operations and executive support
* Project management experience
* Event related experience
* Travel industry experience


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: IT arkitekt infrastruktur
description:
Vi söker nu en IT arkitekt infrastruktur till vår IT-avdelning.
   

  

 På IT-avdelningen är vi ca 350 medarbetare och vårt samhällsviktiga uppdrag gör att vi behöver bli fler. Som en del av vår IT-avdelning kommer du att jobba i en utvecklande miljö, med fokus på medarbetares engagemang och nya idéer. Vi lägger samtidigt mycket energi på att skapa en inkluderande kultur med fokus på jämställdhet och hållbara medarbetare. Vi tror att olika perspektiv och erfarenheter gör oss bättre!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Rollen innebär huvudsakligen att leda arkitekturarbetet inom IT-infrastrukturenheten.
   

  

 Du ansvarar för att ta fram förslag på IT-infrastrukturarkitektur, besluta om IT-infrastrukturarkitektur samt säkerställa att beslutad arkitektur följs.
   

  

 Vår utveckling inom IT-avdelningen sker enligt SAFe-ramverket. Vi är virtuellt organiserade i en tågstruktur enligt SAFe-ramverket och det finns ett infrastrukturtåg.
   

  

 I rollen ingår du även i tågledningen för infrastrukturtåget.
   

  

 Du kommer därför primärt att jobba inom ett infrastrukturtåg med att analysera, utvärdera, planera och dokumentera olika arkitekturella lösningar för IT-infrastruktur.
   

  

**Din profil**
 För att trivas i rollen som IT arkitekt infrastruktur hos oss är det viktigt att du som person har god analytisk och problemlösande förmåga samt en god samarbetsförmåga. Du behöver kunna ta egna initiativ, ha ett gott omdöme och ha en helhetssyn på verksamheten för att kunna verka i rollen.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och lämplighet för rollen.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Minst gymnasieutbildning
* Mycket goda kunskaper om IT-infrastruktur, server, virtualisering, container, lagring, nätverk
* Minst tre års erfarenhet av att ha jobbat i en motsvarande roll
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Akademisk utbildning inom relevant område
* Erfarenhet av arbete enligt agila metoder som tex SAFe


**Vi erbjuder**
 Ett myndighetsuppdrag som är viktigt på riktigt! En arbetsplats där vi värnar om att våra medarbetare ska ha en god balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi erbjuder flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet att jobba delvis hemifrån. Som statligt anställd har du även goda anställningsvillkor och ett förmånspaket med friskvård, lediga klämdagar samt goda semester- och pensionsvillkor. Vårt kontor i Stockholm ligger centralt.
   

  

 Du kan läsa mer om våra förmåner och hur det är att jobba hos oss här.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid och vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning.
   

  

 Anställningen kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass.
   

  

 Placeringsort är Stockholm eller Luleå.
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 Vi jobbar kompetensbaserat i hela processen och är måna om en inkluderande, rättvis, objektiv och kandidatvänlig process. Därför ber vi dig att besvara ett antal urvalsfrågor istället för att be om personligt brev.
   

  

 Vi kan komma att använda oss av arbetspsykologiska tester.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter kontakta rekryterande chef som hjälper dig med din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och ser mångfald som en styrka och välkomnar därför sökande med olika bakgrund.
   

  

 Inför rekryteringsarbetet har vi tagit ställning till annonskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanber oss därför ytterligare kontakt med media-/annonsförsäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.
   

  

 Pensionsmyndigheten ansvarar för den allmänna pensionen och informerar om hela pensionen. Varje år betalar vi ut cirka 415 miljarder kronor till 2,3 miljoner pensionärer, genomför cirka 911 000 fondbyten och skickar ut 8 miljoner orange kuvert. Vi har ca 25 miljoner digitala kundkontakter per år. Vi är cirka 1700 medarbetare på åtta orter, från Luleå i norr till Halmstad i söder.
   

  

 Vi gör pensionen enklare.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: PSL 2025-184 | Kontakt: Per Schölin 46104542258, | Facklig företrädare: Anna-Karin Åhrman Cortelius, Saco-s 010-4543914, Michael Karlsson, ST 010-4543427, | Publicerat: 2025-11-24 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-12-14

title: Tech Lead Manager to Sinch
description:
*Are you seeking a role that perfectly balances deep, hands-on technical work with impactful people leadership?* 




  





**About the job** 




 This is a direct recruitment, which means that the recruitment process takes place through Bravura and you are employed directly by Sinch.
 



  





**About the company** 




 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch’s Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
 



  





 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
 



  





 At Sinch we “Dream Big”, “Win Together”, “Keep it simple”, and “Make it Happen”. These values are our foundation!
 



  





**Tasks and responsibilities** 




 Sinch is seeking a Tech Lead Manager to guide their In-App Calling team. This is a unique 50/50 hybrid role where you will lead a full-stack team responsible for the critical client-side SDKs and backend services that enable seamless in-app voice and video calling within our customers' applications. You will be instrumental in shaping our technical landscape and fostering the growth of our people.
 



  





 You will be empowered to drive excellence across two key areas:
 



  





**As a People Leader (50%):** 



* Cultivate a high-trust, inclusive engineering culture through dedicated coaching, continuous feedback, and personalised career development plans for each team member.
* Define clear team objectives, remove obstacles, and ensure your team is motivated, engaged, and aligned with our strategic goals.
* Champion a collaborative environment where continuous learning and shared ownership are paramount.



  





**As a Hands-On Engineer (50%):** 



* Dedicate half your time to designing, coding, and delivering features for our core backend services, leveraging your expertise in technologies like .NET.
* Lead by example in code reviews, architectural discussions, and by evangelizing best practices in software craftsmanship.
* Actively contribute to and improve our DevOps culture, including our CI/CD pipelines, Infrastructure as Code, and Kubernetes deployments.



  





**Education, experience and personal characteristics** 



* Deep Technical Extensive hands-on experience in backend development with a history of building scalable, production-grade systems on cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
* Demonstrable experience in a formal or informal leadership capacity (e.g., as a manager, team lead, or senior mentor) and a genuine desire to help engineers grow their careers.
