* The ability to articulate complex technical ideas clearly in English, build consensus, and inspire a team toward a common goal.
* A Servant-Leader Mindset: You are proactive, collaborative, and view your primary role as enabling your team to do its best work.



  





**What Success Looks Like** 



* **Within** 
 3 Months, You'll... have built strong relationships with your team, shipped your first significant piece of code, and established a solid partnership with your Product Manager to align on the roadmap.
* **Within** 
 6 Months, You'll... be leading the delivery of a key team project, have established a cadence of meaningful career conversations, and be driving an initiative to improve your team's technical operations.
* **Within** 
 1 Year, You'll... be a trusted and indispensable leader, having demonstrably improved both your team's health and the quality of its technical deliverables while contributing to the strategic roadmap.



  





**Other information** 




**Start:** 
 Upon agreement
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm
 



**Salary:** 
 Upon agreement
 



  





 We use a competency-based method in all recruitment processes to ensure unbiased selection. We also work with ongoing selection, which means that we’ll take down the job ad when enough candidates have reached the final steps of the process.
 



  





 If you are considered for the position, we will contact you for an initial interview. Regardless of whether you proceed in the process or not, you will receive feedback on your application.
 



 If you have questions about the service or about your application, you are welcome to contact our support by emailing info@bravura.se or calling 010-171 47 10 and we will help you. Please indicate which service it applies to.
 



  





 We recommend that you submit your application immediately as we make a continuous selection.
 



  





 Welcome with your application!

title: AI Solution Architect
description:
*Vill du vara med och bygga morgondagens AI-lösningar som gör skillnad för hela Länsförsäkringar? Vi söker nu en AI-arkitekt som vill ta en nyckelroll i vår satsning på att utveckla och förvalta innovativa AI-system. Hos oss får du arbeta nära både verksamhet och IT, och vara med och skapa en säker, ansvarsfull och skalbar AI-plattform som stöttar hela vår affär.*
*Inom avdelningen Data & AI skapar vi nya möjligheter till proaktiva kundmöten och sömlösa helhetslösningar. Här kan du växa, utvecklas och vara med och bygga framtiden, på riktigt.*
**Om jobbet**
 Som AI-arkitekt hos oss blir du en central spelare i vår förändringsresa mot att bygga vårt CoE inom Data & AI. Du kommer att vara med och forma hur vi använder AI i hela organisationen, från strategi till implementering, och bidra till att våra AI-initiativ går hand i hand med Länsförsäkringars övergripande mål.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* Utforma arkitektur och lösningar för AI/ML inom vår Data & AI-ekosystem
* Samarbeta med affär, IT och data för att bygga och skala AI-baserade system
* Designa molnarkitektur för AI och data samt driva innovation i hela organisationen
* Stötta team och medarbetare i att bygga kompetens inom AI/ML
* Bidra till att teknik och strategi går i takt med företagets mål
* Företräda AI-initiativ både internt och externt


 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* Flera års erfarenhet av mjukvaru- eller lösningsarkitektur, samt vana att leverera AI/ML-lösningar i produktion
* Gedigen kunskap inom molnarkitektur (AWS, Azure eller GCP) och erfarenhet av att designa AI-workloads
* Erfarenhet av MLOps och ML-plattformar, inklusive datapipelines, modellcykel, CI/CD och övervakning
* Förståelse för Generativ AI och LLMs, inklusive prompting och prototypframtagning
* Bakgrund inom SaaS, mikrotjänster och API:er kopplat till AI-integration
* Förmåga att kommunicera effektivt med både ledning och tekniska team
* Kunskap om säkerhet, dataskydd och regelverk som AI Act och GDPR


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av agentbaserad AI och orkestreringsramverk
* Kännedom om LangChain, LLMOps, vector search/RAG och retrieval pipelines
* Kunskap om Responsible AI och hur man bygger tillit och transparens i AI-lösningar
* Branscherfarenhet från finans eller försäkring
* Certifieringar inom moln, dataplattformar eller arkitektur


 Som person är du nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och har lätt för att se helheten. Du trivs med att arbeta i en föränderlig miljö och har en stark vilja att driva utveckling framåt. Du är kommunikativ, samarbetsinriktad och har förmågan att inspirera och engagera andra i förändringsarbete.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Vi står inför en omfattande utveckling inom data och AI – ett initiativ som kommer att påverka både vår organisation och vår bransch under lång tid framöver. Just nu bygger vi ett AI center of excellence, där vi tar fram gemensamma plattformar och riktlinjer för hela Länsförsäkringsgruppen, driver på användningen av nya AI-lösningar och säkerställer återanvändbarhet. Genom detta center stärker vi både lokal innovation och gemensamt lärande, samtidigt som vi ökar kunskap och kompetens i hela organisationen.
   

  

 Som AI-arkitekt tillhör du vår avdelning Data & AI, men får också breda kontaktytor över hela Länsförsäkringar. Vi är ett av Sveriges ledande företag inom bank, försäkring och fondliv, och vi satsar stort på digitalisering och innovation. Här får du möjlighet att växa och utvecklas tillsammans med engagerade kollegor, samtidigt som du bidrar till att stärka hela vår affär.
   

  

**Kontaktpersoner**
 Rekryterande chef: mattias.karlsson1@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

 Facklig representant Forena: jessica.loow@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

 Facklig representant Akademikerföreningen: lisa-maria.carensjo@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*

title: Applied AI Automation Engineer
description:
We are seeking a skilled and innovative
 **Applied AI Automation Engineer** 
 to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for transforming prototypes into scalable, production-ready AI-powered automations. You will design and operate solutions that integrate seamlessly with client systems, delivering measurable business impact. This position offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge AI technologies and contribute to meaningful advancements in automation.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
- Develop microservices that encapsulate LLM logic, embeddings, and intelligent agents.

- Design and implement multi-step pipelines and orchestration workflows.

- Deploy, monitor, and maintain solutions in cloud environments, while contributing to CI/CD pipeline improvements.

- Enhance retrieval mechanisms, caching strategies, and error-handling components.

- Participate in design and code reviews, as well as technical planning sessions.

- Translate business objectives into maintainable and scalable workflows.

**Basic Qualifications:**
- 2–3 years of experience in software or automation engineering.

- Proficiency in Python or TypeScript, including asynchronous programming and service design.

- Hands-on experience with LLM/embedding SDKs and vector databases.

- Familiarity with containerization, CI/CD pipelines, and environment configuration.

- Strong understanding of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), prompt tuning, and cost/latency trade-offs.

- Comfortable using AI-assisted coding tools (e.g., Claude Code, Lvable, Cursor, Codex).

**Preferred Qualifications:**
- Experience with agent frameworks such as LangChain or custom-built solutions, and real-time APIs.

- Expertise in retrieval and caching optimization, as well as observability and metrics.

- Proven experience deploying solutions on cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS, or GCP.

**Professional Skills / Behaviors:**
- A builder mindset with a focus on systems thinking and quality.

- Commitment to continuous improvement through testing, documentation, and iterative development.

- Proficiency in English is required. Swedish is optional but advantageous.

- Occasional travel may be required

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
**Xensam: Join the Future of SAM** 




 Xensam is the leader in AI-powered, cloud-based Software Asset Management. Our technology brings clarity to complex IT environments, helping users make smart, data-driven decisions and maximize software ROI.
 



  





 Recognized with the Highest Growth Award and ranked #3 Overall Champion at the Main Software 50 Awards Nordics, we’re scaling fast and looking for people who want to join the journey. At Xensam, you play a key role in a team built on energy, focus, and positivity. We value experience, but even more, the person behind it.
 



  





 Together, we build the future of SAM.
 



  





**About The Role** 




 As our Senior Frontend Developer at Xensam in Stockholm, you will work hands-on and become a proactive technical leader with a strong drive to solve complex problems. You’ll contribute across the entire product portfolio and support the team by providing technical guidance and stepping in wherever your expertise is needed.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




 You will design, develop, debug, test, and enhance high-quality frontend features and integrations using JavaScript and TypeScript. You will collaborate closely with UX Designers, Product Owners, backend, and database developers to deliver great user experiences and ensure accessibility. Furthermore you will:
 


* Take ownership of the technical direction for frontend development, drive architectural decisions, and act as the go-to person for technical guidance during planning, estimation, and reviews.
* Guide the technical execution of projects, ensuring alignment with product goals, scalability requirements, and timely delivery.
* Ensure best practices across development, including CI/CD pipelines, code structure, testing strategies, and maintain high standards for code quality and performance.
* Apply modern security best practices and OWASP guidelines across all development activities.
* Promote engineering excellence by reviewing peers’ work, providing constructive feedback, enforcing best practices, and mentor junior developers.



  





**Qualifications** 



* 5+ years of experience in frontend development, including debugging, testing, and optimizing modern web applications.
* Strong proficiency in JavaScript and TypeScript, with deep experience in React and state management libraries such as MobX.
* Solid understanding of frontend architecture, asynchronous programming patterns, and REST API integration.
* Proficient in Git or similar version control systems, and experienced with utility-first CSS frameworks like Tailwind.
* Strong knowledge of secure coding, authentication protocols (OIDC, JWT), and error handling.
* Good understanding of relational databases and frontend-backend interaction.
* Familiar with Agile methodologies and working in Agile/Scrum teams.
* Experience mentoring, reviewing code, and upholding high standards.
* Comfortable leading technical discussions, architectural decisions, and owning frontend initiatives.
* Good communication skills and a strong proficiency in written and spoken English.
* Preferably a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.



  





**Bonus Points If You** 



* Have a full-stack background, working across both frontend and backend development.



  





**What You Get** 



* A generous work culture with free drinks and snacks, office massages, and more.
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Other location-specific benefits.



  





**Our values at Xensam** 




**Rebellious** 




 We challenge the norm and act with initiative – always with responsibility.
 



**Humane** 




 We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
 



**Harmony** 




 We value balance and create a supportive workplace where people thrive.
 



  





 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

title: Senior Backend Engineer (C# & AWS)
description:
Northmill Bank is a challenger bank at the intersection of technology and finance, committed to revolutionizing the way people manage and protect their financial well-being. We are creating a different kind of banking experience,
 **digital yet personal** 
 .
 



 Northmill Bank was founded in 2006 and have grown to over 200 employees in 3 countries, 4 000 merchants and 600 000 end users. We use the latest technology to develop safe, smart, and user-friendly products for our customers. They are the sole reason why we do what we do. We are a 100% cloud-based product company where technology is the driver to create smarter banking products.
   





 Grab this opportunity to be a part of us and our journey!
 



**About the role**




 As a Senior Backend Engineer, you will play a key role in designing and developing modern financial applications that power our banking ecosystem. You will build and enhance advanced monitoring systems that support our operations in AWS cloud environments, ensuring reliability, performance, and scalability.
 



 In this role, you'll collaborate closely with our business teams and the clients who rely on our products, giving you meaningful influence over how our applications evolve.
 



 Your daily work will involve technologies such as C#, .NET, ASP.NET, and AWS (including Fargate, Lambda, S3, and EventBridge), as well as tools like Jira, Confluence, Git, and Rider/Visual Studio. You will work with established architectural patterns such as DDD and CQRS, and you’ll also leverage modern AI-powered development tools to boost productivity and code quality.
   





**Required qualifications:**



* 5+ years of commercial experience in creating web applications.
* Solid experience developing applications using C#.
* Solid experience in working with SQL databases.
* Willingness and interest to collaborate and work in a team.
* Stockholm as a place of living & SE citizenship or EES Resident status.



**Preferred qualifications:** 



* Experience with software engineering best practices (code reviews, continuous integration, continuous deployment, testing).
* Exposure to Agile development methodologies.
* Familiar with Web services/web API.
* Familiar with the AWS platform.
* Experience in working with NoSQL databases



**About you** 




 You’re a creative and curious person with a genuine passion for software development. Like us, you love learning, staying up to date with the latest tech trends, and writing clean, high-quality code.
 



 You’re comfortable sharing your thoughts, raising problems early, and contributing to thoughtful solutions. You thrive in a team environment and have experience working in an Agile setup.
 



 As we’re a multicultural team, strong proficiency in English is required.
 



**What we offer**



* A fantastic office in a prime Stockholm location with great spaces and views
* An independent role with the opportunity to make a real impact
* Great opportunities for professional development
* Health - 5 000 kr health care allowance
* Conference abroad every other year
* Breakfast and fruits every day, as well as "holy fika” each Friday
* Regular after work and celebrated successes at the office



**Apply today and be a part of Northmill!**

title: Sales Engineering Manager, Benelux & Nordics
description:
**About Us**
 We are the leader in human-centric cybersecurity. Half a million customers, including 87 of the Fortune 100, rely on Proofpoint to protect their organizations. We’re driven by a mission to stay ahead of bad actors and safeguard the digital world. Join us in our pursuit to defend data and protect people.
   

  

 How We Work
   

  

 At Proofpoint, you’ll be part of a global team that breaks barriers to redefine cybersecurity, guided by our BRAVE core values Bold in how we dream and innovate, Responsive to feedback, challenges, and opportunities, Accountable for results and best-in-class outcomes, Visionary in future-focused problem-solving, Exceptional in execution and impact.
   

  

**Company Overview**
 At Proofpoint, we have a passion for protecting people, data, and brands from today’s advanced threats and compliance risks. We hire the best people in the business to
   

  

* Build and enhance our proven human-centric security platform
* Blend innovation and speed in a constantly evolving cloud architecture
* Analyze new threats and offer deep insight through data-driven intel and artificial intelligence
* Collaborate with customers to help solve their toughest security challenges


 We are singularly devoted to helping our customers protect what matters most – their people and their data. That’s why we’re a leader in next-generation cybersecurity—and why 85% of the Fortune 100 trust us as a security partner.
   

  

  

  

**The Role** 
  

  

 Proofpoint is seeking an experienced and dynamic Sales Engineering (SE) Manager to develop a successful Enterprise franchise in partnership with the Regional Sales leader. You will lead and develop a team of talented sales engineers across Benelux & Nordics, with the key objectives of building pipeline, winning new and add-on business and developing happy customers on our Human-centric security platform. This individual will be a major contributor to our aggressive growth plans for the region and should ideally be located in Denmark or Sweden.
   

  

**Your day-to-day**
* Partner closely with the Regional Sales leader to build a strategy for growth and execute on it
* Accountability of all technical sales and satisfaction activities in the region, including formulating strategies to penetrate target accounts and expanding existing customers
* Highly engaged with customers, including evangelizing the Proofpoint vision at all levels, from technical to C-suite executives
* Attract, hire and retain top talent to support our rapid growth, including developing and mentoring team members to help them achieve their career goals, ideally here at Proofpoint
* Coach, enable, and develop a team of elite Sales Engineers in the key areas of Product and Technical Expertise, Owning the Technical Sales Process, Valued Solutions that Deliver Outcomes and behaving as a Trusted Advisor
* Foster a culture of continual learning, information sharing and collaboration amongst the team to keep all team members current on the latest innovations and build wisdom from recent customer engagements
* Actively collaborate with key internal stakeholders such as product, channel, customer success, marketing, services and support to build pipeline and ensure customer loyalty
* Engage and sponsor key local channel partners that support your business
* Encourage, initiate and execute local initiatives to grow the business
* The role is highly customer and partner facing and will require ~50% travel within the region


**What You Bring To The Team**
* Leadership & initiative – a motivated self-starter brimming with ideas, with the discipline and drive to execute on them to yield the desired outcomes
* A mature technically astute but business centric engineer with a proven ability to command a room, guide complex technical and business conversations with C-suite executives, as well as technical staff
* A commercially savvy technical sales leader who can partner effectively with sales leadership to develop and grow the business
* Proven experience of managing sales engineering teams, ideally in the cyber-security industry based on extensive previous experience as a sales engineer
* Track record of mentoring and developing team members and guiding them to success
* A strong collaborator with internal and external stakeholders, with a willingness to actively engage in discovering opportunities and problem solving at a technical level
* Ability to thrive in a fast paced, high energy sales environment
* Degree in Computer Science preferred or equivalent IT experience
* An excellent communicator and presenter with fluency in English and either Swedish, Danish or Dutch



**Why Proofpoint**
 Protecting people is at the heart of our award-winning cybersecurity solutions, and the people who work here are the key to our success.  We’re a customer-focused and driven-to-win organisation with leading-edge products. We are an inclusive, diverse, multinational company that believes in culture fit, but more importantly ‘culture-add’, and we strongly encourage people from all walks of life to apply.
   

  

  

  

 We believe in hiring the best and the brightest to help cultivate our culture of collaboration and appreciation. Apply today and explore your future at Proofpoint!
   

  

 Why Proofpoint? At Proofpoint, we believe that an exceptional career experience includes a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. Here are just a few reasons you’ll love working with us
   

  

* Competitive compensation
* Comprehensive benefits
* Learning & Development We are committed to the growth and development of our team members, offering a range of programs including leadership and professional development workshops, stretch project assignments, and mentoring opportunities to help employees reach their full potential.
* Flexible work environment [Remote options, hybrid schedules, flexible hours, etc.].
* Annual wellness and community outreach days
* Always on recognition for your contributions
* Global collaboration and networking opportunities


 Our Culture
   

  

 Our culture is rooted in values that inspire belonging, empower purpose and drive success-every day, for everyone. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please reach out to accessibility@proofpoint.com. How to Apply Interested? Submit your application here https //www.proofpoint.com/us/company/careers. We can’t wait to hear from you!

title: Informationssäkerhetschef (CISO)
description:
Informationssäkerhetschef (CISO)
 



 Riksbanken är Sveriges centralbank. Vi ska se till att inflationen är låg och stabil över tid, bidra till att det finansiella systemet är stabilt och effektivt och se till att det går att göra betalningar. Riksbanken ger också ut Sveriges sedlar och mynt.
 



**Informationssäkerhetschef (CISO)** 




  





*Vill du leda utvecklingen av Riksbankens arbete med informationssäkerhet? Är du en förändringsledare som vill lägga grunden till Riksbankens förstärkta informationssäkerhetsarbete?* 




  





**VI ERBJUDER DIG** 




  





 Riksbankens arbete med informationssäkerhet ska stärkas. Som informationssäkerhetschef (CISO) kommer du att leda detta utvecklingsarbete. Du får möjlighet att arbeta i en miljö där säkerhet är viktigt på riktigt och där du ansvarar för centrala delar av det systematiska säkerhetsarbetet.
 



  





**DET HÄR GÖR DU HOS OSS** 




  





 Som informationssäkerhetschef tillhör du säkerhetsenheten och rapporterar till säkerhetschefen. Du ansvarar för att leda och utveckla Riksbankens informationssäkerhetsarbete inklusive övergripande kravställning inom it- och cybersäkerhet. Du är tillsammans med övriga deltagare i säkerhetschefens ledningsgrupp delaktig i arbetet med att styra, samordna, stödja och följa upp Riksbankens samlade säkerhets- och säkerhetsskyddsarbete.
 



 Som chef stödjer och utvecklar du medarbetare och verksamhet. Det innebär att du bygger team, delegerar ansvar, leder mot mål, inspirerar och ser till att det finns en god struktur för arbetet. Du arbetar strategiskt med att utveckla gruppens arbetssätt och processer samtidigt som du säkerställer att gruppen hanterar sitt operativa uppdrag på ett effektivt sätt. En viktig uppgift är att skapa och välfungerande samarbeten med övriga enheter och avdelningar inom Riksbanken samt inom gruppen.
 



  





**DITT TEAM** 




  





 Du leder en grupp med ca tio medarbetare som bland annat arbetar med kravställning och stöd i informations- och cybersäkerhetsfrågor, genomför uppföljningar och informationsklassningar, håller säkerhetsutbildningar samt stödjer projekt med informationssäkerhetskompetens. I din grupp ingår även medarbetare som hanterar olika uppgifter inom säkerhetsskyddsområdet.
 



  





 Riksbanken består av totalt nio avdelningar. Säkerhetsenheten tillhör avdelningen för intern styrning och verksamhetsstöd. Här kan du läsa mer om hur Riksbankens organisation.
 



  





**MER OM DIG** 




  





 Vi söker dig som har en relevant akademisk utbildning alternativt annan utbildning och arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig. Du har erfarenhet av arbete som chef med ansvar för budget och personalfrågor.
 



 Vidare har du mångårig erfarenhet av arbete med informationssäkerhet och erfarenhet av att ha arbetat i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Erfarenhet av att arbeta med ISO 27001 och annan relevant reglering som DORA och NIS är meriterande liksom arbete inom offentlig sektor och framför allt på statlig myndighet. Du har mycket god kunskap i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
 



 Du har erfarenhet av att utveckla team och driva förändringsarbete. Du är en relationsbyggare som förstår vikten av att skapa starka och hållbara samarbeten både inom teamet och med övriga delar av organisationen. Genom ditt ledarskap skapar du en kultur av tillit, öppen kommunikation och framåtblickande arbete där alla arbetar mot samma mål.
 



 Som person är du strukturerad, tydlig och beslutsför. Du planerar, organiserar och prioriterar arbetet på ett effektivt sätt vilket gör att du kan hantera en hög arbetsbelastning. Du är mål- och resultatorienterad samt tar stort ansvar för helheten. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
 



  





**MER OM TJÄNSTEN** 




  





 Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse
 



 Anställningstyp: Tillsvidareanställning, provanställning kan tillämpas
 



 Placering: Huvudkontoret Stockholm
 



 Arbetstid: Förtroendearbetstid
 



 Möjlighet att jobba distans: 1 eller 2 dagar i veckan
 



 Förmåner: Generösa semestervillkor, löneväxling till pension, subventionerad lunch, friskvårdsbidrag, subventionerad massage och tillgång till gym och ledarledda träningspass.
 



  





 Tjänsten kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning innefattande registerkontroll, säkerhetsprövningssamtal och särskild personutredning görs då för slutkandidaten. För vissa tjänster ställs krav på svenskt medborgarskap.
 



  





**ATT JOBBA PÅ RIKSBANKEN** 




  





 Riksbanken är en myndighet under riksdagen som ser till att pengarna behåller sitt värde över tid och att betalningar kan ske säkert och effektivt. Vi ger också ut Sveriges sedlar och mynt. Vi arbetar på medborgarnas uppdrag för en stark och säker ekonomi. Här får du utmaning och utveckling varje dag i en händelserik miljö. Hos oss får du kunniga och engagerade kollegor och stor möjlighet till kompetensutveckling.
 



  





**ANSÖK** 




  





 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Riksbanken med rekryteringsföretaget Human Capital. Deras rekryterare gör ett första urval i samråd med rekryterande chef samt utför intervjuer. De kandidater som går vidare träffar sedan rekryterande chef.
 



  





 Vi vill ha din ansökan med CV och personligt brev senast den
 ***12 januari***
 . Vi vill att du besvarar ett antal urvalsfrågor. På så vis kan du enkelt söka tjänsten och vi ges möjligheten att utvärdera våra kandidater på lika villkor. Logiska tester och arbetsprov ingår som en del av rekryteringsprocessen. Riksbanken genomför också bakgrundskontroller på slutkandidaterna, vilket innebär kontroll av examensbevis eller annat dokument som styrker din utbildning.
 



 Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!
 



  





 Kontaktperson
 



 Rekryterande chef
 



 Robert Sirkka
 



  





 Rekryterare
 



 Hanna Looström 070-937 40 16 hanna.loostrom@humancapital.se
 



 Elnaz Adilipour, elnaz.adilipour@humancapital.se, 073-352 34 81.

title: Digital Media & Global Systems Manager
description:
**Varför Mediaplanet?**
 Ta chansen att kliva in i
 **ett globalt ledande medieföretag** 
 där innovation och tillväxt står i centrum. På vårt
 **Huvudkontor i Stockholm** 
 får du en
 **nyckelroll** 
 i den
 **digitala transformation** 
 som nu formar framtidens innehållsmarknadsföring.
   

  

 Var med och utveckla vår digitala produktion, kampanjleverans och systemstöd - både lokalt och globalt.
   

  

 Bli en del av Mediaplanet och sätt ditt avtryck i en bransch där förändring är möjligheten och du är i centrum.
   

  

*****About Mediaplanet** 
 - We Create Impact!**
 Mediaplanet is a world leader in content marketing, creating powerful campaigns together with 15,000+ clients globally. We make branding easy by managing the entire value chain – from concept and production to distribution and collaborations with influencers and world-renowned media partners. As part of Caybon, we have 11 offices across Europe and North America.*
 Vi söker en strukturerad, analytisk och lösningsorienterad
 **Digital Operations & Global Systems Manager** 
 som vill arbeta i en roll som kombinerar operativt digitalt ansvar i Sverige med globalt systemägarskap och utveckling av våra produktionsplattformar.
   

  

**Rollen Fördelas Mellan**
* 60% Mediaplanet Sverige – stöd till VD och säljteamet inom digital marknadsföring, digital budgetstyrning, intern kompetensutveckling och kampanjgenomförande.
* 40% Mediaplanet Global – globalt ansvar för produktionens system, processer och arbetssätt.


 Du rapporterar till VD för Sverige samt till det globala produktteamet.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I den här rollen är du den främsta kontaktpunkten i Sverige för frågor kopplade till digital marknadsföring, kampanjleverans och prestanda. Samtidigt ansvarar du globalt för våra interna produktionssystem, deras utveckling, struktur och utbildning av kollegor i alla marknader. Den här rollen är office first och utgår ifrån huvudkontoret i Stockholm.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
**Digitalt ansvar – Mediaplanet Sverige**
* Vara huvudkontakt för Managing director SE och projektledare i digitala frågor.
* Hålla interna utbildningar om digitala produkter och plattformar.
* Ta fram beslutsunderlag och kostnadsöversikter för digital budget.
* Följa upp, analysera och rapportera digital prestation för att säkerställa ROI och bästa möjliga användning av våra digitala kanaler.


**Kampanjstrategi & Genomförande**
* Skapa och hantera annonser på Meta, TikTok, Youtube, LinkedIn, Display, Google Ads och AdCredo (intern plattform).
* Producera digitalt kampanjmaterial såsom karusellannonser, nativeannonser och videoformat.
* Planera och genomföra digitala kampanjer i linje med kundens mål och kampanjens syfte.


**Målgrupp & Distribution**
* Ta fram målgruppsunderlag, analyser och rekommendationer inför kampanjförsäljning och kampanjplanering.
* Ge råd kring kanalval och övergripande distributionsstrategi.


**Optimering & Rapportering**
* Övervaka kampanjresultat och göra löpande optimeringar.
* Ta fram rapporter, insikter och rekommendationer inför kommande kampanjer.
* Använda GA4 och andra analysverktyg för att följa resultat och dra slutsatser.


**Datakvalitet & Tracking**
* Säkerställa korrekt tracking och rapporteringsstruktur.
* Arbeta med GA4 och Google Tag Manager på en grundläggande nivå.
* Identifiera och rapportera dataproblem, samt säkerställa att de följs upp och åtgärdas.


**Globalt systemägarskap & produktion**
* Ha globalt ägarskap för våra interna produktionssystem och plattformar (inkl. globala Meta- och LinkedIn-uppsättningar samt interna kampanjhanteringssystem).
* Vara kontaktperson för produktionskollegor globalt vid frågor om plattformsuppsättning och systemstöd.
* Utveckla arbetssätt, processer och best practices för digital kampanjhantering och analys.
* Hålla utbildningar för kollegor i samtliga marknader för att säkerställa enhetliga arbetsflöden.


**Vi söker dig som**
* Vi ser gärna att du har arbetat inom digital media i 3-5år.
* Har erfarenhet av digital marknadsföring och praktiskt kampanjgenomförande.
* Är analytisk, strukturerad och trygg i att arbeta med data och budgetunderlag.
* Trivs i en rådgivande och stödjande roll med många kontaktytor.
* Är självgående, lösningsorienterad och motiveras av att utveckla processer och system.
* Har erfarenhet av Meta Ads, LinkedIn Ads, GA4 och gärna Google Ads och GTM.


 Mediaplanet delivers top class content marketing campaigns together with 15 000+ clients globally. Since the start in Stockholm back in 2002, we have grown into the world’s leading content marketing group with 15 offices across Europe and the North Americas.

title: Test and Verification Engineer for 9Air Combat Management System
description:
*Passionate about making ideas a reality? Join our welcoming world of tech and let your ideas soar.*


Your Role


At Product Unit Air C4I, we develop and maintain the Combat Management System 9Air. This product is used for real-time surveillance and combat management in the national airspace. As an example, the product presents a situational picture presented on top of a map, where the operator can follow all objects in the national airspace in real time. The product also includes the 9Air Trainer, which is a simulator and training system.


We are now looking for a Test and Verification Engineer to join our growing team. In this role, you will play a critical part in ensuring the quality and functionality of our systems, with a primary focus on system and Graphical User Interface (GUI) testing.


As a Test and Verification Engineer, you will develop a good understanding for how the customer uses our product. In this role, you will be responsible to:

* Design, develop, and execute test plans and test cases.
* Use various testing methodologies, including black box, white box, and exploratory testing, to identify and report defects.
* Collaborate closely with development teams to understand software requirements and translate them into testable user cases and scenarios.
* Analyze test results, and provide test reports.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of testing processes and methodologies.
* Support with customer training activities.
* Contribute to the writing of our training materials and user manual.


Your profile


Saab is growing quickly and are open to both junior and senior applicants. By working as a team in collaboration with colleagues, we can adapt your tasks and responsibilities to fit your current experience. We understand that junior applicants may not yet have all of the qualifications listed below.


Here are relevant background qualifications:

* Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field in engineering or defense.
* Experience of software testing or software development.
* Understanding of Systems Engineering.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Comfortable speaking in front of a group, like when showing customers how to use our product.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Ability to speak English and Swedish fluently, and ability to write technical documentation in English and Swedish.


The following qualifications are meriting but not strictly required:

* Experience in writing system requirements and breaking these requirements into detailed test cases.
* Experience from automated testing using e.g. Robot Framework or similar frameworks.
* Experience with test management tools (e.g., Jira).
* Experience of combat management systems and the defense industry.
* Experience of team leading and agile ways of working.


This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.


What you will be part of


Explore a wealth of possibilities. Take on challenges, create smart inventions, and grow beyond. This is a place for curious minds, brave pioneers, and everyone in between. Together, we achieve the extraordinary, each bringing our unique perspectives. Your part matters.


Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 26,100 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.


 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here


Recruiting manager: Henrik Frid
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: Technical Lead
description:
At Tata Technologies we make product development dreams a reality by designing, engineering and validating the products of tomorrow for the world’s leading manufacturers. Due to our continued growth, we are now recruiting for a Technical Lead within Diagnostics Operation Development to strengthen our team in Gothenburg, Sweden-
  
The role
  
As Diagnostic Operations development Engineer you will be part of the development team for off-board diagnostics solutions . Off-board solutions provide ways to fault trace, test and calibrate vehicles on aftermarket. This work requires a wide understanding of the complete platform, such as dependencies between functions and how end-user will interact with the tool and vehicle on aftermarket. Problem solving, adaptability, and creative solutions on a case to case basis are strengths that are considered very important in this position.
  
Responsibilities
  
* Develop Diagnostic Service Tool (both test and calibration) Operations
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create optimal solutions for aftermarket
* Verify operations at test rig & complete vehicle
* Develop troubleshooting strategy for DTCs and symptoms that are considered relevant for machine/components within area of responsibility
* Contribute actively in an Agile development environment


Requirements
  
* Minimum 4–5 years of hands-on experience in Embedded Software (preferably within the automotive domain)
* Work Experience with Grade-X or aftermarket diagnostics tools and aftermarket technology
* Solid understanding of electrical systems architecture
* Strong background in complete vehicle level
* Ability to read, analyze, and implement engineering specifications
* Previous experience working in an Agile team setup
* Proficiency in English – both written and spoken


Preferred Qualifications
  
* Exposure to clients software processes and aftermarket area
* Experience with tools and frameworks commonly used in automotive software


If you are passionate about bringing innovation to the projects you work on then we would love to hear from you.
  
**Tata Technologies:** Engineering a better world.
  
Tata Technologies would like to thank all applicants for their interest, each application will be reviewed against the set criteria for the role. We would like to advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted. If you do not hear from us within 10 working days following the closing date it will mean that unfortunately your application has not been successful. We will however retain your details for any suitable future opportunities.

title: Senior QA Engineer, Platform & Partner Experience
description:
Engineering
Backend
Permanent
Stockholm
Experience Mission  

We design Spotify’s consumer experience—end to end, moment to moment, across every screen, platform, and partner integration.
Our mission is to make listening feel effortless, personal, and joyful for billions of users around the world. That means turning complexity into clarity across hundreds of touch points—from our mobile and desktop apps to the smart speakers, TVs, cars, and integrations where Spotify shows up every day.
If it touches a consumer, we shape it. We bring deep insight into human behavior, design, and technology to craft experiences that feel intuitive, expressive, and unmistakably Spotify.  

About the Team  

The Platform & Partner Experience (PPX) Studio shapes how Spotify shows up across devices — from mobile apps to TVs, cars, and partner integrations. You'll join a growing QA Engineering team that supports multiple product squads, builds shared quality tooling, and runs the PPX showroom where partners and internal teams explore new experiences. The team is expanding its automation and AI-driven testing capabilities, and this role will play a key part in taking those efforts to the next level.
What You'll Do

* Work directly with our most important strategic bets to ensure the final user experience meets our quality standards
* Advocate for quality within a cross-functional department, influencing engineers, product managers and designers in quality best practices
* Define test strategies and quality metrics, drive automation efforts, and advise on tooling and methods
* Leverage AI agents within the automation efforts
* Make technical and risk trade-off decisions related to your QA work
* Coordinate testing efforts to ensure the delivery of quality features

Who You Are

* You have experience in manual testing, both hardware and the software that runs on it
* You have ample experience writing automated tests, and using testing frameworks
* You have experience in programming languages, preferably Java, JavaScript or Python, in a professional setting; and have a working knowledge of SQL
* You're comfortable using AI tools such as Claude, Cursor (or others) to help write automated tests
* You can explain QA methodology and tools to technical and non-technical audiences, and have experience or education in a Software Engineer in Test, QA Engineer, or Tester role
* You demonstrate a collaborative and tenacious mindset whilst remaining curious and flexible
* You care a lot about the quality we bring to our users and are invested in working with us to ensure said quality by actively participating and evolving our QA process

Where You'll Be

* This role is based in Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home. We ask that you come in 3 times per week.

Learn about life at Spotify


Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.  

At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.  

  

Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.
Our global benefits


Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
About the Role
  
We are seeking a highly motivated Mechanical/Thermal Process Engineer with strong expertise in heat transfer, thermodynamics, and fluid flow analysis to join our engineering and R&D team. In this role, you will design, analyze, and optimize thermal and fluid systems used in industrial processes, renewable technologies, and advanced manufacturing applications.
  
You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop innovative engineering solutions, improve energy efficiency, and support pilot-scale and full-scale system development.
  
Key Responsibilities
  
Perform detailed heat transfer and fluid flow calculations for new and existing systems
  
Design, evaluate, and optimize thermal and process equipment, including heat exchangers, piping systems, pumps, and membrane modules
  
Develop or support Piping & Instrumentation Diagrams (P&IDs) and functional descriptions for process systems
  
Conduct CFD simulations and analytical modeling to enhance system performance
  
Support pilot plant development, commissioning, and troubleshooting
  
Contribute to energy analysis, system integration, and process optimization projects
  
Prepare technical documentation, test reports, and engineering specifications
  
Collaborate with R&D, production, and operations teams to support ongoing engineering initiatives
  
  

Qualifications
  
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Thermal Engineering, Process Engineering, or related field
  
**Strong understanding of:** Heat transfer (conduction, convection, radiation), Fluid mechanics and hydrodynamics, Thermodynamics and energy systems
  
Experience with CFD tools, heat transfer modeling, or process simulation software
  
Familiarity with process design, thermal equipment, or pilot plant development
  
Ability to interpret and develop technical engineering drawings (e.g., P&IDs, schematics)
  
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
  
  

Why Join Us?
  
Work on cutting-edge solutions in thermal engineering, sustainability, and process innovation
  
Be part of a collaborative environment that values creativity and technical excellence
  
Opportunities for professional development, training, and cross-functional growth
  
Contribute to real-world engineering projects that drive technological progress

title: Java backend
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Experience working with Azure Cloud Technologies and Environment
* Extensive experience building structured Spring boot microservices based on API services (REST/OData)
* Proficient in Java 17 and above
* Understanding of Databases (SQL/PostgreSQL)
* Experience in unit/integration testing
* Experience working with Docker containerization and Kubernetes
* Experience working with external integrations
* Experience working with code optimization and performance improvements
* Experience of agile way of working and Jira
* English skills are mandatory, Swedish is a merit


**Meritorious**
* DevOps experience (CI/CD, Azure)
* Experience of SAP ERP, ex S/4
* Experience of retail and working with article data in larger organizations


**Application deadline:** 
 11-12-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Software Engineer, Data
description:
**Description**
 We are a well-funded, early-stage startup on a mission to guide the world's money. Data sits at the center of everything we build, from ingesting financial data, augmenting data through ML & GenAI, to exposing core datasets for financial decision-making. To accelerate this, we are hiring a
 **Software Engineer, Data** 
 to shape and scale our data foundation from day zero.
   

  

 Are you passionate about building data infrastructure from the ground up? Do you thrive in high-growth environments where you can shape both the technical architecture and the team? Do you want to define how data flows through a platform used by modern finance teams? Then we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

**About Palm**
 At Palm, data is at the foundation of everything we do. We're building a sophisticated application that helps enterprises make smarter financial decisions. You will get the opportunity to build back-end foundations that power embedded analytics dashboards, a ML-powered forecasting engine, and GenAI capabilities. This role is your chance to architect and build out data-heavy back-end capabilities that will help us scale from being a challenger in the market to a leader in the enterprise treasury space.
   

  

 This role isn’t about maintaining legacy systems, it's about building foundations. You'll work directly with our leadership team to define our data strategy, establish best practices, and create the foundation for our data-driven products.
   

  

 We are defined by our values:
   

  

* Speak with Courage: We make pragmatic technical decisions and own the outcomes.
* Lead with Curiosity: We explore new data patterns and technologies to stay ahead.
* Work with Heart: We embrace the complexity of financial data and turn it into clarity.


 You'll be working side by side with product, ML engineers, and customer operations, with a clear path to technical leadership as we scale.
   

  

**How will you make an impact?**
* Design foundations that help us build scalable data ingestion using tools like Airflow, Pubsub and Cloud Run on GCP.
* Be at the forefront of using AI assisted workflows, e.g. using coding tools like Cursor and Claude Code, or prepare detailed implementation plans using large-context models like Claude Opus and Gemini 3 Pro.
* Set up and manage data integrations using tools like dltHub to power integrations for various financial data sources.
* Build and manage our data infrastructure through infrastructure as code and support other engineers in their data & infra needs.
* Design a high-performance data warehouse in BigQuery to serve analytics, ML and internal products.
* Drive engineering excellence through version control, CI/CD, testing, and reusable frameworks.


**Where we work**
 Palm is a remote-first company, with team members across multiple locations. We value flexibility and believe the best work often happens outside the office.
   

  

 That said, this is a
 **core technical role** 
 . To build our data platform collaboratively and support each other in a high-growth environment, we'll have regular in-person sessions with the engineering team and founders. We'll work together to determine the right cadence that supports both flexibility and collaboration.
   

  

**Our wish list**
**Must-haves**
* 3+ years in a data or back-end engineering role with strong data affinity.
* Proficiency in data processing using Python since it powers a significant amount of our data processing.
* Comfortable with leveraging AI-assisted workflows and tools in the development process.
* Track record of building back-end systems that are the back-bone to analytics, ML and GenAI use cases.
* Knows their way around designing data models for row-based databases (e.g. PostgreSQL) and columnar based data warehouses (e.g. BigQuery, Clickhouse).
* Expertise in building integrations with third-party API’s or data integrations using tools like dltHub, Fivetran or Airbyte.
* Experience with cloud platforms (GCP preferred), infrastructure as code, and cloud cost optimisation.
* A startup mindset being scrappy, product-driven and comfortable with ambiguity.
* Strong ownership mentality with the ability to work independently but also collaboratively drive projects to completion.


**Nice-to-haves**
* Domain knowledge in fintech, financial data, or banking systems.
* Having worked in an infrastructure or DevEx related role such as Data Platform Engineer, DevEx Engineer or Infrastructure Engineer.
* Experience with Go.
* Prior experience in a rapid-growth scale-up/startup environment.
* Knowledge of event-driven architectures and real-time data processing.
* Contributions to open-source data tools or communities.


**Benefits Of Working At Palm**
* Travel 🛫 Meet all your new colleagues at quarterly off sites - the last 3 were in Berlin, Rotterdam & Marbella.
* Coworking Membership 🏰 Work from home is our go-to - we love spending time with friends and family instead of commuting. We have WeWork or Rivvia memberships for when you want to escape into the city.
* Stock Options 📈 Own a large chunk of Palm and reap the rewards as you help us grow the company to a global player.
* Career Growth 💫 Clear path to a Head of Data or Staff Engineer role as we scale.
* Impact 💥 Your achievements will define our data infrastructure, ML capabilities, and analytics frameworks.
* Pension 🧑‍🌾 Everything you need to not worry about life after work.
* Health Insurance 🩺 Best-in-class local insurances to help you get treatment quickly whenever you may need it.
* Wellness Stipend 💆🏾 500 EUR in annual wellness benefits - gyms, massages, you name it.
* Time Off 🏝️ 30 paid holidays for you to take time to recharge and relax.
* Homeoffice Stipend 💻 500 EUR to upgrade your home office


 Research shows that women and underrepresented groups only apply when they meet 100% of the criteria. We're not looking for perfection - if you're passionate about the role and have most of the skills, please apply!

title: Test Lead
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Deep experience of Lumera and its fund trading module.
* Strong experience in writing and managing test cases in Jira (XRAY) or similar test management tools.
* Proven ability to teach and coach others through hands-on, practical guidance.
* A strong understanding of how test cases should be structured to enable automation.


 Swedish and English
   

  

**Meritorious**
* Experience supporting teams during transitions to new core systems.
* Ability to visualise and map fund execution flows to support testing and automation.


**Application deadline:** 
 11-12-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

title: Implementation Engineer
description:
Intric is accelerating its growth, driven by a fresh round of funding from investors and strong demand from both existing and new customers.
   

  

 Our platform - Intric.ai - is currently transforming how work is done, primarily within the public sector and companies that value data sovereignty, by making the power of AI accessible to a wider audience. We have secured a market-leading position in a niche of this segment.
   

  

 We are seeking a motivated individual eager to embark on the journey of a lifetime with our expanding and driven team.
   

  

**Your role**
 As an Implementation Engineer, you will working forward deployed with our customers. We believe that for us to be truly successful, and for our customers to get the true value of AI, we need to integrate our platform deep into our customers existing infrastructure. This is where you come in.
   

  

 You will work directly with customers to understand their technical requirements, deploy our platform, and build custom integrations that ensure our AI capabilities become an integral part of their day to day.
   

  

**Who You Are**
* You have 2+ years of experience in technical implementation, solutions engineering, or similar customer-facing technical roles
* You possess strong technical skills with experience in enterprise infrastructure, APIs, and integration patterns
* You're a problem solver who thrives on tackling complex technical challenges
* You have excellent communication skills in English, with additional European languages being a strong plus
* You're passionate about AI and its practical applications in solving real business problems
* You're willing to travel in order to fulfill your responsibilities


**Key Responsibilities**
 You will be instrumental in ensuring our customers successfully deploy and adopt our platform. Your work will directly impact customer satisfaction and our ability to embed our solution. This includes:
   

  

* Be a part of the sales process, providing technical support to prospective customers
* Deploy and integrate our platform in customer environments, working with their existing systems and infrastructure
* Build custom integrations and solutions tailored to specific customer needs
* Provide technical support to customers throughout the implementation process
* Collaborate with the product team to improve our platform based on real-world deployment experience


**What We Offer**
* An opportunity to be a part of building a system and company that defines the future
* Rapid career development in an exciting, fast-moving sector
* Competitive compensation package combining salary and stock options

title: Pega Senior Developer
description:
Permanent Employment – Sweden
   

  

 Experience Level: 6+ years in Pega development
   

  

**Job Summary**
 We are seeking a highly experienced Pega Certified SSA (CSSA) or Pega LSA Part 1 with applications built on Pega Constellation architecture. The ideal candidate will have deep experience in Pega platform capabilities, particularly with Constellation UX, and will work closely with stakeholders, developers, and architects to translate business requirements into end-to-end solutions.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Work on Complex user stories around design and development of Pega applications using Pega Constellation and latest features of Pega Infinity.
* Collaborate with LSA, BA to ensure alignment between Blueprint models and Pega implementations.
* Define Low-level architecture and Low level design patterns for Pega solutions from High level design
* Ability to lead 2 -3 Developers (CSA Levels)
* Ensure adherence to Pega best practices and coding standards.
* Participate in all phases of the SDLC including design, development, testing, and deployment.
* Create and maintain technical documentation.
* Troubleshoot and resolve performance issues and bugs.


**Required Skills & Qualifications**
* Pega CSSA Certification (mandatory). Pega CLSA Part 1 will be a advantage
* Extensive experience with latest Pega (minimum 8.x) platform, Exposure to Pega Infinity 24.x
* Knowledge of Blueprint for process modelling and requirement gathering.
* Knowledge in Pega Constellation, Case Management, workflow, and Integration.
* Knowledge of object-oriented programming and design principles.
* Experience with Agile methodologies and tools like JIRA.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Experience with Pega DevOps and CI/CD pipelines.
* Knowledge of Pega DX API and UI/UX best practices.
* Exposure to cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).


**About Cognizant**
 Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 194 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.

title: Test and Verification Engineer for 9Air Combat Management System
description:
*Passionate about making ideas a reality? Join our welcoming world of tech and let your ideas soar.*
 Your Role
   

  

 At Product Unit Air C4I, we develop and maintain the Combat Management System 9Air. This product is used for real-time surveillance and combat management in the national airspace. As an example, the product presents a situational picture presented on top of a map, where the operator can follow all objects in the national airspace in real time. The product also includes the 9Air Trainer, which is a simulator and training system.
   

  

 We are now looking for a Test and Verification Engineer to join our growing team. In this role, you will play a critical part in ensuring the quality and functionality of our systems, with a primary focus on system and Graphical User Interface (GUI) testing.
   

  

 As a Test and Verification Engineer, you will develop a good understanding for how the customer uses our product. In this role, you will be responsible to:
   

  

* Design, develop, and execute test plans and test cases.
* Use various testing methodologies, including black box, white box, and exploratory testing, to identify and report defects.
* Collaborate closely with development teams to understand software requirements and translate them into testable user cases and scenarios.
* Analyze test results, and provide test reports.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of testing processes and methodologies.
* Support with customer training activities.
* Contribute to the writing of our training materials and user manual.


 Your profile
   

  

 Saab is growing quickly and are open to both junior and senior applicants. By working as a team in collaboration with colleagues, we can adapt your tasks and responsibilities to fit your current experience. We understand that junior applicants may not yet have all of the qualifications listed below.
   

  

 Here are relevant background qualifications:
   

  

* Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field in engineering or defense.
* Experience of software testing or software development.
* Understanding of Systems Engineering.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Comfortable speaking in front of a group, like when showing customers how to use our product.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Ability to speak English and Swedish fluently, and ability to write technical documentation in English and Swedish.


 The following qualifications are meriting but not strictly required:
   

  

* Experience in writing system requirements and breaking these requirements into detailed test cases.
* Experience from automated testing using e.g. Robot Framework or similar frameworks.
* Experience with test management tools (e.g., Jira).
* Experience of combat management systems and the defense industry.
* Experience of team leading and agile ways of working.


 This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.
   

  

 What you will be part of
   

  

 Explore a wealth of possibilities. Take on challenges, create smart inventions, and grow beyond. This is a place for curious minds, brave pioneers, and everyone in between. Together, we achieve the extraordinary, each bringing our unique perspectives. Your part matters.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 26,100 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

 Recruiting manager: Henrik Frid
